Currently she has a tailoring business, which she learned when she was working in a previous job.  Later, when she got married, she decided to set up her own shop.

The loan Brenda will get is to increase her capital by buying fabric, which she'll get from the stores in the city of El Alto and, after production, sell in her stall.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her household as much as possible, because she's married and has four children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the health field.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Flor De Damasco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE DAMASCO”  Iniciarán el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Delia es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción de frutas, elaboración de canastas y carnicería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Delia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de frutas; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió desde niña, ya que en su comunidad se realiza este tipo de producción.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de abono) que adquirirá de los vecinos de comunidades aledañas y posteriormente lo utilizará para el cultivo de sus productos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Communal Bank “Flor de Damasco” is in its first cycle with Pro Mujer in the regional office of Patacamaya. The group is composed of twelve members and run by a board where Delia is the president. The members have different activities, such as growing fruits, making baskets and a butcher’s shop.

The loan they are requesting will help micro entrepreneurs such as Delia. She says this is the first time she is part of Pro Mujer and that she joined when a friend who is a member invited her. Delia grows fruits, an activity she learned when she was a little girl, as it is very common in her community.

With this loan she will buy compost from nearby localities and use it for her plantations. This business leaves her resources with which she tries her best to maintain her family, since she lives in a common-law marriage and has a son. She says that what she likes the most about Pro Mujer are the training sessions and the possibility to save some money.

loans.use: to buy compost to grow fruits.

loans.name: Trabajadoras Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TRABAJADORAS HORMIGUITAS”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lourdys es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: ayudante de tejido, costura de faldas, tejido de mantas de vicuña, venta de cosméticos, tienda de barrio, ayudante de albañil, costura de chamarras y pantalones.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lourdys es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de chamarras, deportivos, etc.; este negocio lo emprendió de con un pequeño capital que tenía, ya que aprendió la técnica de costura con su prima cundo le ayudaba en su taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en otros departamentos de Bolivia. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “TRABAJADORAS HORMIGUITAS” communal bank will begin its second cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Panamericana center. It is made up of nine members and led by a board of directors, of which Lourdys is the Secretary. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them are: weaving assistant, sewing skirts, weaving alpaca blankets, selling cosmetics, a general store, a bricklaying assistant, and sewing jackets and pants. 

The loan the will take out will benefit the micro-businesswoman, including Lourdys. She says that four years ago she joined Pro Mujer, at the invitation of a counselor from the institution, who went to visit her at her house. Right now, she has a business sewing jackets, and sports clothes, etc. She started this business with what little capital she had, since she learned sewing techniques with her cousin when she helped her at her workshop. 
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying fabric that she will acquire from wholesale stores in the city of El Alto. After production she will sell in other departments of Bolivia. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her home as much as possible, because she is single and has two children.    

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the area of health.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Vicuñitas De Huayna Potosi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VICUÑITAS DE HUAYNA POTOSI”  iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Luisa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: empleada de un frial, salón de peinados, tejido de mantas, joyería, ayudante de minibús, venta de mantas, venta de salteñas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Luisa es integrante, ella indica que hace siete meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación su cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de salón de peinados; este negocio lo emprendió con la ayuda de su amiga quien le dejo este negocio, ya que ella emprendió el viaje a otro país.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de secadora, cepillos, productos cosméticos) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente instalará en su espacio de servicio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones de salud y crédito.

En la fotografía se encuentra la hermana del socio, ya que él salio a su trabajo con urgencia.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Vicuñitas de Huayana Potosi” will begin its tenth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the regional office of German Busch. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a governing board of which Luisa is the president. The businesses that the members of the association work in are varied. Among them are: the employee of a chicken store, a hair salon, weaving blankets, jewelry, the assistant for a minibus, selling blankets, and selling meat pies.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-businesses of which Luisa is a member. She indicates that she became a member of Pro Mujer seven months ago, joining through an invitation from her sister-in-law, who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a hair salon. She launched this business with the help of her friend who left it to her, when she began a trip to another country.

The loan that she will now take out is for the increase of capital (the purchase of a hair dryer, brushes, and cosmetic products), which she will acquire from the wholesale shops in the city of El Alto. Subsequently, she will set up in her service space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as much as possible since she is married and has two children.

In the photograph, the sister of the member can be found, since she urgently left for her business.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer, brushes, and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Villa Eguez Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA EGUEZ”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Santusa es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: machame de mantas, venta de USB, taller de costuras, tejido de busos, tejido de chompas, venta de audífonos, macramé de mantas, maestro de albañil.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Santusa es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una Asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de pensión (venta de comida); este negocio lo emprendió de con la compra de una cocina, misma que adquirió con el primer préstamo que realizó en la institución, en la actualidad va mejorando y ampliando su capital.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras y pollos) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera pero cuida a sus padres.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Villa Eguez communal bank is starting their third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional office. They have eight members and are run by a board of directors with Santusa as the Secretary. The members' businesses are diverse and are moving along. The various businesses include making macrame blankets, selling USBs, tailoring, sewing blouses, sewing sweaters, selling hearing aids, and working as a construction foreman.

This loan will help member Santusa's small business. She joined Pro Mujer five years ago after being invited by one of the institution's advisors who was visiting her house. She currently has a home-based restaurant and sells food. She started this business by buying a kitchen, the same one that she got with her first loan through the institution. Now, she is improving and increasing her capital.

This loan will allow her to increase her capital and buy vegetables and chicken. She will get these from businesses in the city of El Alto. After preparing the food, she will sell it in her sales area. This type of work allows her to gain resources to maintain her home since she is single and cares for her parents.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the training in health and financing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Manzanitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MANZANITAS”  Iniciarán el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mercedes es el Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ladrillos, confección de polleras, venta de ropa, costura de centros.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mercedes es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad él tiene un negocio de fabricación de ladrillos; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió hace cinco años atrás, al iniciar su familia con su pareja, mismo que anteriormente trabajaba en esta actividad.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de horno) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The Manzanitas communal bank is starting it's first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación regional office. They have eight members and are run by a board of directors with Mercedes as the President. The members' businesses are diverse and are moving along. The various businesses include selling bricks, making polleras (skirts), selling clothing, and sewing centerpieces.

This loan will help member Mercedes's small business. She said that this is the first time she's joined Pro Mujer, after being invited by a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business in making bricks. She learned this skill five years ago, after starting a family with her partner, who worked in this job before.

This loan will allow her to increase her capital and buy an oven. She will buy this from wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto. Then she will sell it at a customer's request. This type of work allows her to gain resources to maintain her home since she has a partner and two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Mercedes said that she likes the training in financing and health.

loans.use: to buy an oven.

loans.name: Grupo Nacer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GRUPO NACER”  Iniciarán el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Corina es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesana en mantas, tienda de barrio, producción y venta de papa, trigo, papa deshidratada (tunta, y chuño), librería, venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Corina es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción y venta de papa, trigo, papa deshidratada (tunta, y chuño); cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió desde niña, ya que en su comunidad se realiza este tipo de producción.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semilla y forraje) que adquirirá de los vecinos de comunidades aledañas y posteriormente lo utilizará para el cultivo de sus productos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “GRUPO NACER” communal bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Patacamaya center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors of which Corina is the Treasurer. The businesses have are varied. Among them are artisanal blankets, a general store, growing and selling potatoes, wheat, dried potatoes (tunta and chuño), a book store and selling cattle. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the small business women, including Corina. She says that this is her second cycle that she has been a member of  Pro Mujer and she joined at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Right now, she has a business growing and selling potatoes, wheat and dried potatoes (tunta and chuño). She says that she learned this business as a child, since in her business this kind of farming was done.
 
The loan that she will take out now is to increase capital by buying seeds and fodder that she will acquire from the residents of the nearby community. Later she will use them to grow her products. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her home as much as possible. She is in a common law marriage and has four children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the area of health.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fodder.

loans.name: Paceñitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PACEÑITAS”  Iniciarán el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Basilia es el Secretario. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de ladrillos, venta de productos nutricionales, venta de cinturones, costura de colchones, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Basilia es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su hija que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad él tiene un negocio de venta de ladrillos; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás, ya que es un negocio familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ladrillos) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The Paceñitas communal bank is starting their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación regional office. They have eight members and are run by a board of directors with Basilia as the Secretary. The members have a variety of businesses and they are moving along. The types of businesses include sewing blankets, selling bricks, selling nutritional products, selling belts, sewing mattresses, and selling food.

This loan will help member Basilia's small business. She said that she joined Pro Mujer six months ago, after being invited by her daughter who is a member. Basilia currently has a business selling bricks. She has been in this business for many years since it's the family business.

This loan will allow her to increase her capital and buy bricks. She will get them from a wholesale distributor in the city of El Alto and then she will sell them at a customer's request. This type of work allows Basilia to earn income and support her household since she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said she likes the financing and health training.

loans.use: to buy bricks.

loans.name: Renacer De Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RENACER DE NUEVO AMANECER”  Iniciarán el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hilda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de golosinas, macramé de mantas, tienda de barrio, artesanías.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hilda es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad él tiene un negocio de taller de trenzado y tejido de mantas; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió al apoyar a su madre, ya que es un negocio familiar, cuando se caso decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela y lana) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito que se ofrece.
texts.en:
The Renacer de Nuevo Amanecer communal bank is starting their fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela regional office. They have nine members and are run by a board of directors with Hilda as the President. The members have a variety of businesses and they are moving along. The types of businesses include selling soft drinks, making macro me blankets, managing a neighborhood store, and making crafts.

This loan will help member Hilda's small business. She said that this is the first time she joined Pro Mujer, after being invited by a friend who is a member. Hilda currently has a workshop where she works by braiding and sewing blankets. She said that she learned these skills from her mother and that this is the family business. When she got married, she decided to start her own business.

This loan will allow her to increase her capital and buy fabric and wool. She will get these supplies from a wholesale distributor in the city of El Alto and then she will make and sell the blankets to customers who requested them. This type of work allows Basilia to earn income and support her household since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said she likes the financing that they offer.

loans.use: to buy fabric and wool

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various groceries like beverages, seasonings and toiletries

loans.name: Manantial Azul Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MANANTIAL AZUL”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Justina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de papa, costura de prendas, venta de plantillas de zapatos, costura de chamarras

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Justina es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de tejido de mantas; este negocio lo aprendió en un institución técnica, posteriormente con un  poco capital compro su máquina de tejer y con el crédito de Pro Mujer amplio su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The A.C. "Manantial Azul (Blue Spring)" will begin its first term of Pro Mujer (Pro Woman) as a part of the Focal Point in Collpani. It is composed of eight members and is headed by a board and Justina is the President. The businesses that the community association members carried forward are varied among them which include: weaving blankets, sewing garments, and coats along with the sale of shoe insoles and potatoes. 

The loan they will take out will benefit small microenterprises where Justina is a member. She points out that two years ago, she became a member of Pro Mujer through the invitation of a friend who was also a member of the institution. 

Currently, she has a business workshop in blanket weaving.  She learned this type of work at a technical institute. Beforehand, with a little amount of capital, she bought a sewing machine and with the Pro Mujer loan, she expanded her business. 

The loan that she will take out will increase capital by purchasing wool from other stores in the city of El Alto. After production, she will sell it in her sales area. This type of job will allow her to generate income so that she can maintain her home. She is married and has four kids. 
 
When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she said that she liked the health and loan training.

loans.use: to purchase wool

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente es un hombre honrado, trabajador y responsable, vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, él  se dedica al cultivo de pilones de café,  posee clientela establecida ya que vende los pilones a un buen precio, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se les  presentan en su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos como: abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. para poder seguir con sus cultivos y obtener mejores ganancias con sus ventas para tener con su compañera de vida  una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client is an honest, hardworking and responsible man.  He lives in his own home with his life partner.  He makes his living growing coffee seedlings.  He has an established clientele because he sells the seedlings at a good price.  With what he gets from his sales, he is able to cover the costs that arise in his home.

The client is applying for a loan to buy inputs such as:  compost, fertilizers, pesticides, etc. to be able to continue with his crops and earn a better income from his sales, so that he and his life partner can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Jesudegbe Group

texts.fr: JESUDEGBE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Sabine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 33 ans. Sabine a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau secondaire. Sabine est mariée à un certain Jacques. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sabine vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour ce faire, Sabine vend des tissus dans sa région depuis environ cinq ans. Sabine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Sabine s’associe aux autres membres du groupe JESUDEGBE pour solliciter un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The JESUDEGBE group consists of three members who live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Sabine, age 33, seen with a hand raised in the photo. Sabine received secondary level schooling. She is married to a man named Jacques, and the couple have three dependent children who go to school. 

Sabine lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. To that end, Sabine has been selling fabrics locally for approximately five years. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

To strengthen her activity, Sabine is seeking this loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the JESUDEGBE group

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  Janeth has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  She has been in this business for 5 years now.  In the future, Janeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Bismilla Group

texts.en:
The Bismilla Joint Liability Group was formed in the year 2013 by four active women of Titilagarh town of Bolangir district in Odisha, India to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their businesses. Samasun, aged about 39 years, is one of them. The lady standing second from right in the photo and raising her hand is Samasun. She lives with her husband and three sons, aged 12, 9 and 5 years. All her children are continuing their study in the local school.

Samasun herself has been running a small general store in her house for the last eight years with the help of her husband. She sells general grocery items like sugar, lentils, biscuits, soft drinks, toffee, etc. Her husband is managing a tent house business with decoration items, utensils and light materials. Her net monthly income from the existing business is Rs. 4,000 (rupees). Out of this income, she has been able to contribute some part for household expenses like the educational expenses of her children. 

Samasun purchases stock for her business daily from the wholesalers of the town. As per her statement, she was able to increase the variety of items in her shop, but not the inventory. She wants to increase the stock of her business from this loan amount by purchasing items like lentils, soap, biscuits, spice items, etc. for her general store. This will help her to reduce her purchasing costs and save time, as she has to refill her stock on a daily basis. 

Samasun dreams to provide better education to her children, as she believes that education is the pillar of all success.

The other four members of the group are Idan, Basanti and Sabanam, who are running a welding center, dry food making and selling business, and cycle-repairing center respectively.

loans.use: to purchase lentils, soap, biscuits, spice items, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. She has seven children and has been doing this work for 20 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops.

She stated that a good crop harvest is what is most enjoyable about farming. Her biggest challenge is taking care of crops to maturity. Animals on the farm have been given no names. Mary was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied that they deliver their services to farmers. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session. She replied that micro loans are helping poor people to improve their business and change their lives.

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Mary replied it will improve their farming methods and make more income.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Mary owns a cow, poultry, and a bicycle but does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower does not have a mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Ipptsam

texts.en: Ipptsam lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 32 years old and a married business lady with one child. She started a clothing business mostly selling the traditional khangas to the locals. She has been in the business for the last two years and the business has been growing. She knew of Milango through friends and she decided to join so that she can save and with time be able to access credit to fund her business. She now seeks a loan to buy khangas to sell. She hopes that in the next five years she will be running a successful boutique that will be able to serve many. The challenge in the business is the lack of capital and the competition that is sometimes very stiff. The income she will raise will improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy khangas

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a 24-year-old energetic and diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband, 2 sons, and 2 daughters. Her husband is a stonemason. Sobia is an efficient door-to-door equipment provider by profession. She sells different kinds of things related to daily needs like kitchen equipment, soaps, and crockery items.  

Since 2009, she has operated her own door-to-door service providing business. Her daughter is also involved in her business and helps her mother. Currently, her stock is almost finished, therefore Sobia needs to purchase some products to continue her business.

For that, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a new variety of products. With the profit amount, she will continue her business by adding more variety. 

She dreams to live a happy, healthy, and peaceful life with her family. Many thanks and best wishes to all staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan from her.

loans.use: to buy more stock for equipment selling business like kitchen equipment, soaps and items.

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia, the leader of this group, is a 44-year-old widow and a mother of two boys, 14 and 16 years old. They are studying in secondary school. 

After her husband's death, Asia became the sole provider for her family. She has experience in making clay Tandoor ovens. She started her business in her backyard. She brings the hard clay and makes Tandoors to sell to neighbors. 

When Asia heard about Izdiharona's 'qard hassan' product for widowed women, she took a loan to renovate her home and to make a roof for her backyard, to protect her from the sun, heat, and rain. 

Asia is aiming to grow her business and to increase her profits to provide a good life for her family.

The story of Asia and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development's clients.

loans.use: to renovate her home.

loans.name: Miel Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MIEL”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gilka es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de lencería, elaboración de artesanías, atención de internet, elaboración de manualidades, venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gilka es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una sobrina que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad él tiene un negocio de taller de manualidades; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió al observar los programas televisivos donde realizaban estas actividades y con la compra de unas revistas.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de goma eva) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “MIEL” will begin its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Focal Center of Villa Tejada. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board of governors of whom Gilka is the president. The businesses that the members of the association work in are varied. Among them are: lingerie sales, traditional crafts production, internet service, handicraft production, cosmetics sales, and clothing sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-businesswomen like Gilka. She indicates that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer, becoming a member through the invitation of a niece who is a member of the institution. Currently, her business is a handicrafts workshop. She says that she learned this business by watching television programs where they carried out these activities and with the purchase of some magazines.

The loan that she will now take out is for the increase of capital (the purchase of Eva rubber foam) that she will acquire from wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto. Subsequently, she will sell her creations to customers by special order. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home in all ways possible since she is married and has children.

When she is consulted about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the credit and health training that it provides.

loans.use: Compra de eva

loans.name: Dalias Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DALIAS”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elvira es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mandiles de cholita, artesanía, venta de comida, tejido de chompas, venta de chicharrón de soya, tejido a máquina de chompas de alpaca, brostería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elvira es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de mandiles de cholita; este negocio lo emprendió al observar el buen comercio que tenía.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquina recta) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
Dalias Communal Bank will start its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Regional Office.  It's made up of nine members governed by a board of directors of which Elvira's the secretary.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including traditional aprons, handicrafts, food sales, knitting sweaters, selling soybean cracklings, knitting alpaca sweaters by machine, and roasting chicken.

The loan they're going to get will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Elvira.  She says she has been with Pro Mujer for three years, having joined on the invitation of a counselor from the institution who visited her at her house.  Currently Elvira has a business making traditional women's aprons, which she started when she saw the business had good sales. 

The loan Elvira's going to get is to increase her capital by buying an upright sewing machine.  She'll get it from the distribution companies in the city of El Alto and sell what she makes in her sales stall. This form of work allows Elvira to generate resources to support her household to the extent possible, because she's married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says the health and loan training.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO AMANECER”  Iniciarán el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Herminia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesana en tejido de mantas, venta de helado, comerciante de ganado, venta de mantillas, venta de papa y chuño, venta de colchones.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Herminia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de colchones; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace cinco años atrás como un negocio independiente, ya que anteriormente trabajaba con sus padres pues es un negocio familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de colchones) que adquirirá de las ferias mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el aumento de capital al que nos ayudan.

En la fotografía esta presente la madre de una de las socias, ella esta vestido con manta verde.
texts.en:
Nuevo Amanecer Communal Bank will start its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members governed by a board of directors of which Herminia's the president.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including weaving shawls, ice cream sales, cattle sales, shawl sales, potato and "chuño" [freeze-dried potato] sales, and mattress sales.

The loan they're going to get will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Herminia.  She says she has been with Pro Mujer for two loan cycles, having joined on the invitation of a friend who's a member.  Currently she has a business selling mattresses, which she says she started five years ago as an independent business.  Previously she had worked with her parents in a family business.

The loan Herminia's going to get now is to increase her capital by buying mattresses, which she'll get from the wholesale markets in the city of El Alto and then sell in her sales space.  This form of work allows her to generate income to support her household to the extent possible, because she's in a common-law marriage and has four children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says the trainings and the increase in capital that they help with.

The mother of one of the members appears in the photograph wearing a green shawl.

loans.use: to buy mattresses

loans.name: Retoños Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RETOÑOS”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Roció es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de polleras, repostería, venta de comida, confección de enaguas, tejido de mantas, carpintería, licorería, tienda de barrio

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rocío es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una vecina que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de carpintería; este negocio lo aprendió al conocer a su pareja, ya que el trabajaba en esta actividad, posteriormente a formar su familia empezaron a emprender por su taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de madera) que adquirirá de las barracas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Retoños communal bank will begin their fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Collpani regional office. This group has eight members. It is led by a board of directors headed by Roció who is the president. The members’ businesses are varied and include sewing skirts, pastry-making, petticoat making, weaving blankets, carpentry, distilling and running a neighborhood store. 

This loan will benefit small business owners such as Rocío. She joined Pro Mujer two years ago when she was invited by a neighbor who is a member of the institution.  Currently, she has a carpentry workshop. She learned this business when she met her partner. Since he works in this field, after they started a family, she started at the workshop. 

The requested loan will be used to increase capital (purchase of wood) in order to acquire wood from the barracks in the city of El Alto. Then, she will sell the products in their retail space. This way of working allows her generate resources to maintain their home because she is in a common- law marriage with three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the trainings on health and loans.

loans.use: purchase wood

loans.name: Primero De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMERO DE MAYO”  Iniciarán el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de chompas, elaboración de papas fritas y chicharron, chofer, venta de ollas, venta de comida, selección de café, venta de chantilin, atención de baño público.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad él tiene un negocio de venta de gelatinas y refrescos; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de una amiga que realizaba la misma actividad.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de azucar) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará de forma ambulante en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The “PRIMERO DE MAYO” ["May 1"] communal bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación regional center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors, of which Juana is the secretary. The businesses pursued by the communal bank members are diverse. They include: weaving sweaters; preparing fried potatoes and fried pork; driving; selling pots; selling food; coffee sorting; selling whipped cream desserts; and providing public restroom services. 

The loan they are taking out will benefit small entrepreneurs in the group where Juana is a member. She reports that she joined Pro Mujer six months ago, on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling gelatins and sweet drinks. She says that she learned this trade from a friend who was involved in the same activity. 

The loan that she is requesting is to increase her capital (to buy sugar). She will buy it from the wholesale distributors in the City of El Alto, and then after preparing her products, she will sell them as a mobile vendor at the local markets. This way of working allows her to generate resources to maintain her household as well as possible, since she is single and has one child. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training sessions about credit and health, as well as the savings.

loans.use: to buy sugar to prepare her products.

loans.name: Flor De Vida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE VIDA”  iniciará el vigésimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mercedes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de conservadoras, taller de costura, costura de overoles, venta de refrescos, venta de queso, venta de medallas

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mercedes es integrante, ella indica que hace once años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de queso; este negocio lo aprendió de su madre hace varios años, posteriormente decide emprender un negocio independiente en el que lleva más de veinte años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de queso) que adquirirá de las barracas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “FLOR DE VIDA”  communal bank is starting their 21st cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani regional office. It is made up of 8 members and is lead by a board of directors with Mercedes serving as president. The businesses of the members vary, amongst them : selling commercial display coolers, dressmaking, making coveralls, selling soft drinks, selling cheese, selling medals. The loan will benefit all of the members.

Mercedes as one of the members, said she joined Pro Mujer 11 years ago, on the invitation of a friend who is also a member of the institution. Mercedes runs a business selling cheese. She learned the business years ago from her mother and then decided to start her own independent business. She has done this for over 20 years. 

The loan Mercedes is requesting is to increase her working capital (buying cheese) in the markets of the city of El Alto and later resell in her commercial space. This work allows her to generate the resources she needs to support her household as she is married and has two children. Asked what she liked about Pro Mujer she replied that she enjoyed the health and loan training sessions.

loans.use: to buy cheese.

loans.name: Chheng Leang

texts.en:
Chheng Leang (pictured here) is a tailor. She lives in the suburb of Phnom Penh City. Her husband is a moto kangbei taxi driver and a carver. In the past, the three-wheeled motorcycle taxis were commonly known as "tuk tuks", but they are now officially called "moto kangbei" by government authorities.
Chheg Leang has been married since 2006 and has one young son who is in school. She had already asked for Kiva loan, and she now applies for another loan in order to buy her neighboring land to expand her property.

loans.use: to buy her neighboring land to expand her property.

loans.name: Luz Clarita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ CLARITA”  Iniciarán el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sonia es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de frutas, tienda de barrio, tejido de mantillas, chofer asalariado, tienda de ferretería, tejido de chompas, taller de cerrajería, venta de papa y chuño.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sonia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad él tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace dos años atrás al observar la necesidad que tenía sus vecinos de un espacio de compra.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de abarrotes, enlatados) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito que se ofrece.
texts.en:
Luz Clarita Communal Bank will start its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members governed by a board of directors of which Sonia's the secretary.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including fruit sales, a neighborhood store, knitting shawls, a salaried driver, a hardware store, knitting sweaters, a locksmith shop, and potato and "chuño" [freeze-dried potato] sales.

The loan they're going to get will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Sonia.  She says she has been with Pro Mujer for a year, having joined on the invitation of a friend who's a member.  Currently she has a neighborhood store that she set up two years ago, seeing her neighbors' need for a place to buy things.

Sonia's loan is to increase her capital by buying groceries and canned goods from the wholesale stores in the city of El Alto.  Later she'll sell them in her sales stall.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her household to the extent possible, because she's married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says the loans that are offered.

loans.use: to buy groceries and canned goods

loans.name: Prados De San Roque Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRADOS DE SAN ROQUE” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elsa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: constructora, elaboración de chompa de bebe, venta de busos, venta de hortalizas, costura de sacos, hilado de lana de vicuña, venta de queque de nuez.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elsa es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicios de construcción; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo, ya que anteriormente trabajaba como ayudante con él, posteriormente a su matrimonio deciden comprar máquinas para el flete
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquina mezcladora) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la Cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el trabajo en los grupos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Prados de San Roque is beginning its third cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes. It is made up of eight members and is headed by a board with Elsa as the President. The business that members of the communal bank are in are varied, among them are: construction, making baby sweaters, selling sweatshirts, selling vegetables, sewing bags, spinning vicuna wool, and selling walnut cakes.

The loans they take benefit the small entrepreneurial businesses where Elsa is a member. She indicates that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for a year, joining through the invitation of an advisor of the institution who came to see her at her home. Currently she has a construction services business. She says she learned the business from her husband, as previously she worked as an assistant to him. Before her marriage they decided to buy machines for their inventory. 

The loan that she is asking for now is to be used to increase her capital (to buy a cement mixer) that she will buy from the stores in the city of El Alto and then install it in her workspace. This type of work permits her to generate income in order to support her family, as she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responded that she likes to work in groups.

loans.use: Compra de máquina mezcladora

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema was born in 1951. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Dair Alla with her 4 children. Her husband works in agriculture. 

Haleema’s daughter is studying for a Bachelor's degree in Accounting and is in her 4th year. She is planning to continue her studies and work in her field of study after graduation in order to start helping her mother Haleema financially.  Haleema is currently facing a financial crisis, which is preventing her from paying her daughters’ upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Racheal was able to get a Kiva loan that she paid back without much challenge.  Her business improved after the loan term and she was able to pay school fees for the children.  She hopes that the business will grow.  She owns another business close to the tailoring business and she is now seeking to fund it.  It's a retail shop.  She seeks a loan to buy household items like sugar and flour to sell. The challenge in the business is the competition.  She hopes that the business will grow to be able to improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy household items like sugar and flour

loans.name: Omm Sairam Group

texts.en:
Nandini, an active married lady of 34, is a permanent resident of Titilagarh town of Baalngir district of Odisha, India. The young lady standing second from right with a raised hand in the photograph is Nandini. She resides with her husband, one son of 10 years and one daughter of 7 years. 

For the last two years, Nandini has been running a home shop of ladies’ fancy items like bangles, talc, plastic items, cosmetics, ornaments, ready-made garments, etc. in her house. Prior to this business, Nandini's husband was running a tailoring center and was earning a monthly income of 3,000 INR (Indian rupees), which was not at all sufficient to manage the household expenses along with the study expenses of her children. 

So, Nandini discussed the situation with her husband and started this business. Now her fancy store is running well. Nandini brings the stock from different towns like Titilagarh, Bargarh, Raipur, etc. In the present situation, Nandini is earning a monthly income of 3,000 INR and supporting her family. But she has a dream to earn more and establish herself well, so she wants to increase the volume of her business to increase the income. 

This year, Nandini, along with three other like-minded women of her town, formed a group named “Omm Sairam” and availed a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. From this loan amount of 10,000 INR, Nandini wants to invest the entire amount to purchase ladies’ footwear, which will be a new item for her business. She hopes this will attract the women from her locality and fetch a handful of income to her. 

Nandini hopes to construct a good cabin for her business and give better education to her children.

The other three energetic group members are Mita, Sunita and Pramila, who are doing a beauty parlor, dry wash center, and general store business respectively.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' footwear.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is a 48-year-old, hard working and independent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband. Her husband is a carpenter and his income is not enough to meet the household expenses.

To help her husband she has been running a garments shop to meet family's needs. As her clients are demanding, she wants to purchase a variety of garment products for her shop. For that reason, Ghazala has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. On getting a profit, first of all, she will repay the loan amount to Kiva, and then expend the daily sales by adding new variety of products to her shop, as this is her need to meet the demands of clients. 

She hopes that her business grows more and she is very much thankful to both BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy new products.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 29-year-old hardworking woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and 2 daughters. All of her children are studying in school.  She and her husband have owned a boutique for 5 years, which is the only source of income for their family. Now for the further growth of their business Razia has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase some equipment for the boutique. As their family expenditures are much higher as compared to the monthly income and savings, Razia wants to expand her boutique. As a result, they will be able to increase their monthly income as well as savings. Her dreams are for the higher education of her children. She is very thankful to KIVA for such great help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy equipment to expand her boutique.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: Suriya, age 45, lives with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband offers sheltering services. Suriya is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan to purchase bamboo, nails, and iron sheets for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. Suriya hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, nails, and iron sheets for sheltering business.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra, age 50 is a hard working woman. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a cobbler by trade, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase raw material for mending shoes. This will help him to continue his work and to work more efficiently. He does not have enough funds to purchase the needed things. Therefore his wife, Bushra, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. Bushra is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase raw material for mending shoes.

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
In Nazira’s group, she is representing herself as a group leader by raising her hand in the photo.

She is 40 years old and lives with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is very conscious about management, controlling, and handling people. In fact she is a general-store keeper and deals with different people in a day. She is taking responsibility for her group members and assured us about the repayments. 

Nazira is a fresh borrower and vows that she will prove an honest borrower of BRAC. She has been looking for the money for many days so that she could buy some missing inventory. 

Therefore, Nazira has requested a small loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. Through new loan she will buy stocks of flour, detergents, biscuits, and chocolates.

Nazira feels proud to be a member of BRAC. She is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy inventory including flour, detergents, biscuits, and chocolates for her general store.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 27-year-old single man who works as a bus driver. He is well known in his region with his good reputation and commitment, which provides him with courage and support to start his own business. 

But, since he isn’t financially strong enough to start his own business, he is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy his own bus so he can improve his income and develop his living.

loans.use: to buy his own bus.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 57-year-old widowed mother of six children who works as a tailor and has been selling bed shields and blankets for 18 years to provide her children the necessary standards of living; she was also the caregiver to her mother and the wise father at the same time. 

Her business is located inside her house, because she can’t afford the burden of opening an external shop, and she had to stay next to her family since she is the only care provider in the family. 

At the same time, she is the sole breadwinner for three members of her family; that’s why she is a hard worker who puts so much effort to improve her business to make sure that it will have a great impact on her family’s living.  

Fatima is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary tailoring needs, which will improve her business and respond better to her customer's needs. 

For the future, Fatima is willing to expand her business, and she hopes to be financially capable of opening an external tailoring shop that will provide both her family members and customers the privacy they need.

loans.use: to buy necessary tailoring needs, which will improve her business and respond better to her customer's needs.

loans.name: Ghram Group

texts.en:
This group is called “Ghram” and consists of six ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. 

Jalila is 30 years old, a married woman, and has two children. She faces a difficult situation where she lives with her family in a poor area. She is a responsible woman who is interested in giving her children a good life. She suffers a financial challenge to buy what she needs.  

She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy home appliances for her home. She hopes to improve her living standards and enroll her children in school.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for her home.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en: Sobia is a 28-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She initiated her business of milk sales five years ago. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all the daily household expenses. She has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is also respected in her home. Sobia has gradually improved her business and has currently requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for fulfilling her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo for milk sales.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is the mother of 3 children; two of them go to school and one of them is too young.
 
Her husband has been running a restaurant successfully for many years and handling the finance related tasks of his house. This restaurant has been cherishing her whole family for many years.
 
She has been investing the amount of her savings in the current business and for establishing the restaurant well. She is a new member of BRAC Pakistan, and taking her first loan. 

Shabana is taking loan for the establishment of restaurant. In fact, her husband wants to buy food items such as vegetables, beef, grains and ponds, such as sauce pan, caldron for cooking food.
 
Shabana is hopeful that taking this loan would be the cause to get more profit and savings as well.
Shabana says thanks to Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy food items, such as grains, vegetables, beef, and milk for restaurant.

loans.name: Gulbayra

texts.ru: Гулбайре 47 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Гулбайры- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулбайра занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулбайры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова,1 теленок, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулбайра обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулбайра планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует улучшить материальное обеспечение своей семьи.
texts.en: Gulbayra is 47 years old, married and raising three children together with her husband. Gulbayra has a secondary education. To provide the primary source of income for her family, Gulbayra is involved in animal husbandry, having started 20 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulbayra's hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow, 1 calf and 20 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Gulbayra requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy sheep in order to increase livestock headcount. Gulbayra plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and to improve the financial situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Koriyakhon

texts.ru: Корияхон 53 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Корияхон- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Корияхон занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Корияхон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Корияхон обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Корияхон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Koriyakhon is 53 years old, married and raising two children together with her husband. Koriyakhon has a secondary education. To provide the primary source of income for her family, Koriyakhon is involved in animal husbandry, having started 20 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Koriyakhon's hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow. The monthly income amounts to 7,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Koriyakhon requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy a cow in order to increase livestock headcount. Koriyakhon plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
This is the first loan for Nabeela. 

Nabeela is very thankful to Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan. Nabeela is a 30-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her husband’s fruits selling business. Her husband owns a fruits shop and participates in household expenses. He likes to sell seasonal fruits. Now he wants to buy bananas due to lot of demand for seasonal fruits in large quantity, because its' season is going on and its' price is very low.
 
Therefore, Nabeela requested a loan from kiva’s field partner, so that her husband can buy the bananas in large quantity. 
Nabeela hopes that this loan will prove productive for her, and she will save reasonable amount.
Nabeela is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal fruits and bananas for fruits shop.

loans.name: Najum Ul Nisa

texts.en:
Najum Ul Nisa is a 34-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and five sons in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Since 2005, her husband has owned a canteen in a private school and he works very hard to meet his family needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. In this case Najum Ul Nisa decided to start a burger shop so she can help her husband.  Due to lake of funds she has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan money, she can buy a shop to start earning money by selling burgers, as well as to increase her savings for the better future of her children.

Najum Ul Nisa and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to buy a shop.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is a 44-year-old hard-working housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a security guard by profession but his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. Therefore for the past 4 years he has also been driving a taxi at night. Currently he is not able to generate any income from the taxi, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. Rukhsana has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the amount needed to repair the engine of her husband's taxi. With the profit her husband wants to open a new auto mechanic shop in the future. Rukhsana desires to provide quality education to her all children and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very thankful to BRAC.

loans.use: to pay for taxi repairs.

loans.name: Salasala Group

texts.en:
Maua, who is in her late 30s, is married with two boys--one is in school and another is still young. For six years now, Maua has been running two different projects: raising poultry and selling clothes and women's bags up-country. She is doing fine with her businesses. She works from 5 am to 8 pm every working day and is able to earn a small monthly return.
This will be her 8th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, Maua opened her new clothes and bags business, paid for chicken feed and kept on repairing her chickens' place. She used her profit to pay school fees and part of the house's food expenses. Maua will use this loan to add more chicks to her poultry business and increase the store of feed for her chickens. She dreams that one day she will be able to buy a plot of land where she can conduct her poultry-raising and other farming business. 
Maua will share this loan with her loan group “Salasala" which has 5 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to add more chicks to her poultry business and increase the store of feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Walter Edgardo

texts.es: Walter de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol  y adicional a esto trabaja como jornal en una finca cerca de su casa, tiene 4 años de trabajar en la agricultura y ha ganado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde siembra está ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefieren porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un buen servicio; Walter es un hombre activo, entregado a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desea realizar una nueva inversión que le permita aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abono, insecticida, herramientas, fertilizantes, etc. Walter tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Walter, 33, lives in his own house with his life partner. He plants corn and beans and also works as day laborer at a nearby farm. He has been farming for four years, and this valuable experience has led to better harvests. The land he farms is located in a mainly agricultural area that is very close to his house. He sells in all the surrounding areas and has developed loyal customers who like his quality products, affordable prices, and good service. 

Walter is active and dedicated to his work and wants to succeed. He wants to make a new investment to increase his output, so he has applied to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy seed, manure, insecticide, tools, fertilizer, and more. Walter has good credit references and will be able to pay his loan. At the same time, he hopes to make his family more financially secure.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, insecticide, tools, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es: Ana  vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de hamacas desde hace varios años comercializa su mercadería en su casa y de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir  algunos gastos de su hogar, doña Ana esta solicitando un crédito para la comprar de materiales para seguir elaborando las hamacas como: lana, lazos e hilos de colores, ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi seguirá dándole a sus hijos lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Ana lives in her own home with her three children. She has made and sold hammocks for several years. She sells her merchandise in her home and on the street in the various nearby neighbourhoods. With her income she is able to cover some household costs. Ana is requesting a loan for the purchase of materials in order to continue making her hammocks. These include: wool, ties, and coloured thread. This is her only source of work, and it will allow her to continue giving her children what they need without any limit.

loans.use: to buy wool, ties, and coloured threads.

loans.name: Enangnon Group

texts.fr: ENANGNON est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Francisca (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 51 ans. Francisca a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau universitaire. Francisca est mariée à un certain Maturnin. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Francisca vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour faire face aux besoins de sa famille, Francisca vend des mèches, des chaussures et du maïs depuis une vingtaine d'années. De façon secondaire, Francisca vend également divers produits. Francisca s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Francisca s’associe aux autres membres du groupe ENANGNON pour solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The ENANGNON group consists of three members who live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Francisca, age 51, seen with a hand raised in the photo. Francisca attended university. She is married to a man named Maturnin, and the couple have four children who have all received schooling. 

Francisca lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. To that end, Francisca has been selling hair extensions, shoes and maize for some twenty years. She sells various other items as well. She buys her stock at a market in Benin.
