Dans d’accroitre le niveau de son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Philomène ensemble avec les autres membres du GBENONDOU-PAHOU 1 sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The group Gbenondou-Pahou 1 is made up of twenty-two people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, named Philomène (the one with her hand raised in the photo), is 43 years old. Philomène did not attend school. With the objective of raising their business level in order to better meet the needs of their clientele, the group is requesting for the first time the financial support of ALIDé. Philomène is married to a driver by the name of Mathieu. The couple has four children, none of whom are in school and all of whom are in their care. Aside from their children, the couple cares for another child. Philomène lives with her husband and their children. The different needs of the household are taken care of by the couple. It is for this reason that for nine years, Philomène has sold corn and cheese from her home. Philomène stocks up in the market in Benin. In order to grow her level of business and make her clients happy, Philomène, together with the other members of Gbenondou-Pahou 1, requests a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase corn and cheese.

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en:
Mr. Natsagdorj, 30 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. He was decorating building interior components from 2006 to 2012. In 2012, he began to work in a building company as a full-time employee. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors, fiberglass and foam to renovate his house in preparation for the incoming winter. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating and release less pollutants into the air, contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Domingo Antonio

texts.es: Domingo es un hombre dedicado a la protección de su  familia, labora en un centro de salud como técnico epidemiológico, es casado con un hijo pequeño al que le da el apoyo necesario para sus estudios  y cuido personal, este señor tiene la necesidad de mejorar su casa, por eso llego a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito el cual lo utilizará en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como cemento, arena, zinc, perlines y el pago de mano de obra y lograr el objetivo planteado y de esa manera mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: Domingo is dedicated to protecting his family.  He works in a health centre as a technician in the epidemiology department.  Domingo is married and has a young son, whom he gives the necessary support in order to look after and educate him.  Domingo needs to make improvements to his house and so has come to Ceprodel in order to apply for a loan to buy cement, sand, zinc, and purlins, and to pay labourers.  With this he can achieve his objective and improve his living conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, zinc, and purlins, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Concepción De La Cruz

texts.es: Concepción, es  una señora  que se desempeña como auxiliar de enfermería, con 9 años de experiencia de ejercer dicha labor, es  soltera, no tiene ninguna persona su  cargo.  Actualmente está presentando una necesidad de mejorar su viendo, por este motivo se presento a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento. El cual lo utilizara para compra de materiales de construcción  tales como arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra. Lo que vendría a tener mejores condiciones en su hogar y cumplir su sueño
texts.en: Concepción has been working as a nursing assistant for nine years.  She is single and has no children.  Concepción needs to make improvements to her home and so has come to the Ceprodel office to apply for a loan.  She will use the loan to buy building materials such as sand and cement, and to pay labourers.  This will help Concepción to have better living conditions at home and to achieve her dream.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as sand and cement, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Sonia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Sonia , trabaja en un centro de salud del municipio cercano a su habitación, desempeñándose como Odontóloga asistencial con   29 años de laborar, es casada con 3 hijos de los cuales 2 son profesionales y 1 universitario, actualmente está solicitando un pequeño financiamiento para  mejorar su vivienda ya que lo utilizara en compra de materiales de construcción  tales como, cemento, hierro, puertas y pago de mano de obra, visito a ceprodel para gestionar el apoyo que necesita del cual está bien agradecida por la oportunidad y el apoyo inmediato que le han brindado.
Y de esta manera darle mejores condiciones y nivel de vida a su hogar
texts.en: Sonia works at a local health centre, near to her home.  She has been working as a dental assistant for 29 years.  Sonia is married and has three children, two of whom work, and one of whom is at university.  Sonia is currently applying for a small loan in order to improve her home.  She will use the loan to buy building materials such as cement, iron, and doors, and to pay labourers.  Sonia came to Ceprodel for the necessary loan.  She is grateful for this opportunity and support.  With it she will be able to improve living conditions and quality of life at home.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, iron, and doors, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which has a climate that is excellent for agriculture. He has four children and has been doing this work for three years. His primary income sources are milk, tea, and crops.

He stated that mixed farming is what he finds most enjoyable about farming. His biggest challenge is lack of capital. One of the animals on the farm is named Eto.

Bernard was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "It has a grace period." When asked what he learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, he said, "funds small-scale farmers."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how the loan will benefit his family, Bernard said it would increase their income.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Bernard owns a cow, poultry, and a motorcycle, but he does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. Bernard has in his house a mosquito net and a TV, but he does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, or a DVD player.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Juan Arbysio

texts.es:
Juan es un señor  reconocido por el tiempo de ejercer su negocio, como es la panadería, el cual tiene  12 años de experiencia en esta labor, es casado, junto a su esposa, se han ido desarrollando en su pequeño negocio como es la elaboración de diferentes tipos de pan.
Este señor se presento a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento, que lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de pan, como es harina, manteca, azúcar y levadura.
Lo que vendría  ayudarlos a  mantenerse en el mercado ya que lo tienen establecido y así mismo incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos para poder sobre vivir.
texts.en:
Juan is a man who is well known for having operated his business for a while, as his business is the bakery. He has twelve years of experience in this work. He is married, and he and his wife have been developing their small business together, making various types of bread.

Juan came to CEPRODEL's office to ask for financing, which will be used for the purchase of raw material for making bread, such as flour, butter, sugar and yeast. What he sells helps them to stay in the market, as they are established, and likewise helps them increase their sales and income in order to survive.

loans.use: to buy raw material for making bread, such as flour, butter, sugar and yeast.

loans.name: Musarat Jabeen Group

texts.en:
Musarat is an active 58-year-old woman with seven children, with all her children studying in school and college. Her husband is an energetic auto mechanic and also owns a workshop. Musarat has excellent embroidery skills, and she sells embroidered products at the market. Her husband works 17 hours a day, and the demands of his auto parts business are increasing day by day. 
Under the circumstances, Musarat and her husband are interested in expanding the auto parts workshop by purchasing some new parts. 
In this case, Musarat, as a member of a four-member group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase parts and expand her husband's business.
She is so grateful to BRAC and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy auto parts.

loans.name: Dorjpalam

texts.en: Mr. Dorjpalam, 30 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. He has been working as an automobile driver for a private firm since 2008. On his day off, he also provides taxi services to local people. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home looking after their children. He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, and doors. After installing these items into his house, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place. They will burn less coal and release fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to buy vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, and doors for his house

loans.name: Barka

texts.en:
Barka is asking for a loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business.
The previous loan enabled her to save money from her M-pesa services. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to invest in additional float (electronic credits to sell) for her M-pesa business.
She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain a level of profits that helped her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to invest in additional float (electronic credits to sell) for her M-pesa business.

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som, aged 29, has been working in the farming business for many years in Battambang province. She has a few plots of farmland for planting rice and other seasonal crops such as beans, corn, and cassava. Som and her husband help each other maintain a high production in each harvest season. From this type of business, they can make a good profit which they often use to cover their family’s living expenses and send their three children to school. 
At the moment, she has requested a loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, for the purpose of building a latrine for household use. This will enable her to build a healthy family and protect her family members from unexpected illness. She appreciates all the help lenders provide to her whole family.

loans.use: to build a latrine for household use.

loans.name: Victoria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Victoria  es una señora  casada, y se  desempeña como maestra de secundaria en el Instituto de la misma localidad donde habita, atendiendo 1 turnos diurno y impartiendo clases los fines de semana en la localidad donde vive, además su esposo es maestro de secundaria , su núcleo familiar se compone por 2 persona ella, su esposo y  1hijo, el que estudia en el  colegio de la misma localidad, Actualmente  está presentando una gran  necesidad ya que se encuentra mal de salud, por lo que tomo la sabia decisión  de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para ayudarse  en los  costos ya que de su salario familiar no le da para cubrir los gastos familiares y los estudios para la superación  profesional. Ya que el crédito lo utilizaría para el pagos
 Pago de medicamentos, exámenes clínicos: examen general de orina, de sangre, bilirrubina, ultrasonido, TAC, tomografía, compra de lentes y pago de consultas medicas.
texts.en: Victoria is a married woman who works as a secondary school teacher in the educational institution in the town where she lives. She teaches one session each day and also gives classes on weekends in her town. Her husband is also a secondary school teacher. She has two people besides herself in her nuclear family: her husband and one son, who attends school in the same town. Currently, she is facing a great need because she is experiencing poor health. For this reason she made the well-considered decision to visit Ceprodel to request a loan to help with the costs, since her family's income is not sufficient to cover the family expenses as well as studies for professional advancement. The loan will be used to pay for medications, clinical exams including urine, blood and bilirubin tests, ultrasound, CAT, tomography, the purchase of glasses, and payment for medical consultations.

loans.use: to pay for medications, clinical exams, urine and blood tests, ultrasound, CAT, eyeglasses and other expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tires and chains

loans.name: Fitore

texts.en: Fitore is married, is 32 years old and has a 6-year-old daughter. Her husband works transporting and carrying goods for others as needed, and she stays at home caring for the house and their daughter. They are very poor and live under very bad conditions. Recently, the main door of her house has become broken and now the cold and rain have been able to enter the home. Fitore's husband does not earn enough of a salary to repair the door, so she is requesting a loan for a new one before the weather gets even worse. This loan will improve their living conditions, keeping them warm and healthy as well as decreasing or limiting their utility costs. Fitore hopes to find a job and secure a better life for her family. She is very grateful to all Kiva lenders for this support.

loans.use: To buy a new main door for her house

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
For eight years now, Lolita has farmed rice in the town of San Miguel. She is 42 years old, is married, and has seven children. It is quite a challenge for Lolita to wait for a few months before she can have her harvest while also providing for her children. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm so her crops will grow abundantly. 
Her income from farming provides food and school fees for her children.
In the future, she hopes to successfully send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbold, 29 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. Enkhbold graduated from the university in the engineering profession and he has been working for five years. His wife is unemployed and stays at home, looking after their children. 

Enkhbold is requesting a loan of MNT 4,000,000 to buy bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam to renovate his house, in preparation for the coming winter. 

After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is burned for heating, and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate his home.

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en:
Ramzana is 33; she is living with her husband happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband owns a small general store to support his family in a nearby town. He is a very energetic and honest person; he opens his shop early in the morning, and closes it at late night. He is very famous in his area street due to his honesty.

His beloved customers suggested he offer vegetables, because there is no greengrocer shop.  He wants to offer greengrocery, but he does not have the money to buy fresh vegetables to sell. 

Therefore, Ramzana requested a loan for her husband from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband would be able to buy fresh and green vegetables.

Ramzana says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy additional vegetables to sell at the general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a green house

loans.name: Aidana

texts.en:
Aidana is a student at the American University of Central Asia, in the department of International and Business Law; this is her story.

“The American University of Central Asia opens doors to the future, which gives a chance for self-realization. This university is one of the best universities in Central Asia. I would like to become a highly qualified lawyer, as high qualified specialists are always in demand. AUCA gives great academic, professional, and social opportunities to its students. It is the first university in Central Asia offering liberal humanitarian academic programs, accredited in the USA. Graduates of AUCA gain diploma accredited in Bard College, USA. Many graduates of AUCA continue studying in such reputable educational institutions as Harvard, Yale, University of Indiana, Sorbonne, CEU, etc. 

Another positive side of AUCA is that it gives financial support to almost all its students. I would also like to take this opportunity to apply for a KIVA loan, because my family is not able to cover the tuition fees fully.”

loans.use: To pay for higher education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pig feed and maintenance supplies, like pig vitamins

loans.name: Mu'tabar

texts.ru: Муътабар 34-летняя жительница района Дж.Руми. Она работает учительницей в местной школе. Замужем, имеет детей. Сейчас хочет начать семейный бизнес по овцеводству. Она считает, что овцы не прихотливые животные и их выращивание не требует много сил. К тому же это очень прибыльный бизнес. Муътабар будет совмещать новый бизнес со своей основной работой. В ее отсутствии за овцами будут присматривать другие члены семьи. Для начала бизнеса у Муътабар имеется сарай для содержания овец, а также немного сбережения. Для того чтобы закупить 10 голов овец и корм, она просит кредит. Муътабар планирует выращивать овец в течение месяца и затем продавать на рынке с хорошей наценкой.
texts.en: Mu'tabar is a 34 year-old resident of the J. Rumy district.  She works as a teacher at a local school.  She is married and has children.  Currently, she wants to start a family business in animal husbandry.  She thinks that sheep are low-maintenance animals and their care would not require a lot of effort.  Besides, this is a profitable business.  Mu'tabar will combine the new business with her primary job.  Other family members will watch after the sheep in her absence.  To start the business, Mu'tabar has a barn for keeping sheep and also some savings.  She is requesting this loan to buy ten sheep and livestock feed.  Mu'tabar plans to raise sheep for a month and then sell them at a market with a good markup.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep and livestock feed in order to start a new animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Babken

texts.en:
Babken is from Yerevan town where he lives with his mother. It has been already a year since Babken started earning his living by reselling different goods online.  Babken puts the products on his webpage, and mostly sells cultural products. 

Over this year of hard work, Babken already has 35 followers who prefer to order goods only from him. Realizing that the income he gets from this business is important for family's living, this enthusiastic young man needs financial support. He asks for this loan to be able to purchase new stock of goods (cutural items, pictures) and fulfill the orders.

Babken has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
 
The loan is very important to Babken to continue his online business activity, and he hopes for lender's support.

loans.use: to pay for goods (cutural items, pictures)  to sell to customers.

loans.name: Laurent

texts.en:
Laurent is 53 years old. He is married, with four children between the ages of 12 and 22; they all go to school. 

He has been a maize farmer for the past 30 years. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs, and to buy fertilizer during maize production; they need to buy fertilizer to increase their production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production

loans.name: Bobojon

texts.ru:
Бобочону 29 лет.  Бобочон с женой и с двухлетней дочерью живет и работает в селе Хамадони. Он в течение 3 лет работает учителем в средней школе. Бобочон хочет дополнительно заняться растениеводством, как и другие односельчане. Большая часть населения Таджикистана занимаются сельской промышленностью и скотоводством. Причина, по которой население предпочитает такую деятельность, является благоприятный климат и природа Таджикистана. 
  Бобочон на свои сбережения приобрел 1,5 гектара земли и хочет посеять пшеницу и лук. Чтобы осуществить задуманное он берет кредит и на деньги собирается приобрести пшеничных зерен и луковых семян. Он надеется такой труд не останется без награждения, и он в следующем году получит богатый урожай. Благодаря кредиту у него будет дополнительный источник дохода, что намного улучшит его жизнь и жизнь его семьи.
texts.en:
Bobojon is 29 years old. Bobojon works and lives with his wife and two-year-old daughter in the village of Hamadomi. For three years, he has worked as a teacher in a secondary school. Bobojon wants to additionally take up crop farming, like his fellow villagers do. Most of the population of Tajikistan practices farming and animal husbandry. The reason why the population prefers this kind of work is that Tajikistan has an advantageous climate and natural environment.

With his savings, Bobojon purchased a 1.5 hectare plot of land and wants to sow millet and onions there. In order to fulfill his goal, he is taking out a loan and is planning to buy millet and onion seeds with that money. He hopes his work will not be without reward and that next year, he will receive a bountiful harvest. Thanks to the loan, he will have an additional source of income, which will help him greatly improve his life and the life of his family.

loans.use: to buy millet seeds and onion seeds to start his agricultural business.

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.ru: Озоде 52 года. Она мать 2 сыновей. Ее дети находятся за границей на заработках. Муж занимается продажей продуктов питания. Она живет в городе Куляб с мужем и невесткой. Ее невестка умеет шить национальные ватные одеяла и круглые подушки из ваты. Озода тоже знает это ремесло и теперь хочет вместе с невесткой открыть собственное швейное дело и принимать заказы на шитьё одеял и подушек. Для реализации задуманного плана она берет кредит и хочет приобрести швейную машинку и разнообразные ткани. Озода хочет помочь ей и тоже начать зарабатывать.
texts.en: Ozoda is 52 years old.  She is a mother of 2 sons.  Her children are working abroad.  Her husband is involved in selling food products.  Ozoda lives in the city of Kulob with her husband and daughter-in-law.  Her daughter-in-law can sew national cotton blankets and round pillows from cotton.  Ozoda also knows this trade and now wants to open her own sewing business together with her daughter-in-law and accept orders for sewing blankets and pillows.  She is requesting this loan to realize this plan and wants to purchase a sewing machine and various fabrics.  Ozoda wants to help her and also to start earning.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and various fabrics to start her own business

loans.name: Janatkhon

texts.ru: Чанатхон ответственная и позитивная  женщина, а также добрая и заботливая мать. Ей 42года. Она замужем и имеет троих прекрасных  детишек. Муж Чанатхон находится на заработках в России. Там он работает строителем и получает приемлемый доход, который ежемесячно присылает своей семье. Сама Чанатхон вот уже около  семи лет ведёт свой бизнес, который также помогает её семье удовлетворять все свои нужды.  Она занимается выпечкой мучных сладостей, такие как пряники, булочки. Для этого у неё имеется небольшой кондитерский цех. В этом цеху также работают несколько пекарей, потому что сама Чанатхон не справится со всей работой. Сейчас Чанатхон хочет закупить необходимые продукты для выпечки и некоторый дополнительный инвентарь. Так как наступает зимний период и цены на продукты питания могут возрасти, поэтому Чанатхон хочет сейчас закупить все возможные продукты. Для этого она обратилась в Арванд и желает получить кредит на покупку продуктов для выпечки. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Janatkhon, age 42, is a responsible and positive woman as well as a kind and caring mother.  She is married and she has three lovely young children.  Her husband is currently in Russia where he is making a living working as a construction worker.  He makes a reasonable income, which he sends to his family every month.  

Janatkhon herself has been running her own business for almost seven years, which also helps to meet all her family's needs.  She bakes pastries such as cakes and biscuits and she conducts her business in her own, small, bakery shop.  A few other bakers also work in her shop, as Janatkhon cannot handle all the work herself.

Janatkhon wants to buy some goods that she needs for baking, as well as some additional equipment.  As winter is approaching and food prices may go up, she would like to buy everything she can now.  For this purpose, she has turned to MDO Arvand and would like to receive a loan to buy baking goods.  She thanks Arvand in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase baking goods.

loans.name: Pulotjon

texts.ru: Пулотчон трудолюбивый и ответственный человек. Имеет среднее техническое образование. Он родился в селе Хонобод, Исфаринского района Республики Таджикистан. Женат, имеет 4-детей. Один из сыновей находится в трудовой миграции в РФ. Пулотчон работает водителем в комбинате строительных материалов города Исфары. Он хочет построить дом и обеспечить комфортную жизнь своей семье. Но его заработной платы едва хватает для кормления семьи, а для постройки дома он не может накопить денег за счет зарплаты. Поэтому, Пулотчон обратился в Арванд за поддержкой и пользуясь потребительской линейкой кредитных продуктов организации он может реализовать свои планы. На полученный кредит Пулотчон планирует купить строительные  материалы. Заранее выражает благодарность Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Pulotjon is a hardworking and responsible man.  He has a secondary school education with some vocational training, and was born in the village of Khonobod in the Isfara region of Tajikistan.  He is married and has 4 children; one of his sons is currently a migrant worker in the Russian Federation.  

Pulotjon works as a driver in an industrial park for construction materials in the city of Isfara.  He wants to build a home for his family and provide a comfortable life for them, but his income is scarcely enough to put food on the table, let alone set aside money to build a house.  For this reason, Pulotjon has turned to Arvand for help; by choosing from the various consumer loan packages they offer, he will have the money he needs to put his plans into motion. Specifically, he plans on using the loan to buy construction materials, and would like to thank Arvand in advance for their financial assistance.

loans.use: buy building materials

loans.name: Cyprien

texts.en:
Cyprien is 55; he is married with five children. He would like to get a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer to increase their production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production

loans.name: Ervin Domingo

texts.es: Ervin es unos de los padres comprometidos con el desarrollo profesional de sus hijos y protector de la salud de su familia, es casado y con el gran anhelo de seguir apoyando los estudios universitario de la hija que tiene a su cargo, , por eso visito a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento y continuar forjando el sueño de su hija y el de ellos propio como padres, ya que dicho financiamiento lo utilizara en los gastos universitarios y tratamiento médico, de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida de su familia, del cual se siente muy agradecido con ceprodel y los inversionistas de kiva por el apoyo que brindan a los sectores de bajos recursos pero con gran entusiasmo de superar.
texts.en: Ervin is a father committed to the professional development of his children and protecting the health of his family. He is married and has a great desire to continue to support the university studies of his daughter. He is in charge of her studies so he visited CEPRODEL to apply for funding to continue to build the dreams of his daughter and their own dreams as parents. The financing will be used to pay for college expenses and medical treatment to improve the conditions and standard of living of their family. He feels very grateful to CEPRODEL, Kiva, and his investors for their support to groups with little resources but great enthusiasm to overcome.

loans.use: to pay for college expenses for his daughter and medical costs

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana’s husband owns a metal shop in Lahore, Pakistan in which he sells sheets made of steel. His shop is located in the metals market, which is a very crowded place. He used to use a wooden hand trolley to carry his metal goods from one place to another, but his trolley is broken because it has been loaded and unloaded so many times. He wants to buy a new trolley but is unable to afford it. Rehana is requesting a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy a new trolly. Rehana is 33 years old and the mother of three children. Her one son attends school daily.
She is very thankful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy sheets of steel to sell.

loans.name: Hay Vida En Jesus Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores de negocio uno de ellos es Javier hombre de 28 años de edad, soltero, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos  desde hace 3 años. Ofrece sus  productos en su comunidad. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de cosméticos como perfumes, desodorantes, lociones, cremas, pinturas, etc. Julio hombre de 37 años su negocio es la venta de tortillas y refrescos desde hace 3 años y  Dania mujer de 26 años su negocio es la venta de ropa usada desde hace 5 años.
texts.en: This group includes 3 entrepreneurs.  One of them is Javier, a 28 year-old single man.  He's had a business selling cosmetics for 3 years.  He sells his products in the local community.  He needs a loan to buy cosmetics such as: perfumes, deodorants, lotions, creams, lip gloss, etc.  Julio is a 37 year-old man who's had a business selling tortillas and beverages for 3 years, and Dania is a 26 year-old woman who has had a business selling used clothing for 5 years.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as: perfumes, deodorants, lotions, creams, lip gloss, etc.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi received a Kiva loan that she was able to repay without challenges; she was able to improve her grocery store. 

She want to fund her other business, fish selling. She started her fish selling business from the money she got from her husband, and the business has been rewarding. 

She intends to get more capital, and that why she seeks this loan. She seeks a loan to buy fish for selling. She will use the income that she will raise to improve her savings.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru:
Мархабо трудолюбивая,добрая   женщина в возрасте 43 лет. Она  замужем имеет 4 детей.  Ее вид деятельности заключается в том что она  торгует на рынке фруктами и овощами.  Этим видом бизнеса она занимается уже  более 10 лет, как началось сокращения на ткацкой фабрике ей пришлось научиться торговать с матерью. По началу ей помогала ее мама а потом она сама продолжила свой бизнес. За эти 10 лет Мархабо  намного улучшила  условия своего бытия и очень довольна своей деятельностью.   Ее старший сын уехал на заработки в Россию и недавно уехал также и ее муж. Мархабо купила мужу билет на самолет  и  ей пришлось потратить деньги  со своего бизнеса.  Теперь она хочет закупить фруктов и овощей и пополнить свой ассортимент. С этой целю Мархабо обратилась в Арванд за кредитом. 
На полученный кредит Мархабо планирует увеличить торговую лавку фруктами и овощами.  Заранее благодарит Арванд за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Marhabo is a hardworking and kind woman, who is 43 years old.  She is married and has 4 children.  Her business is selling fruits and vegetables at a market.  She has been involved in this type of business for over 10 years since the beginning of layoffs at a sewing factory when she had to learn how to sell with her mother.  Her mother helped her at first and then Marhabo continued her business by herself.  Marhabo was able to improve her living conditions over these 10 years and is very happy with her business.  Her oldest son left to work in Russia, where her husband recently went as well.  Marhabo bought an airline ticket for her husband and had to spend money from her business.  Now she wants to purchase fruits and vegetables and increase her selection.  With this goal, Marhabo requested this loan from Arvand.  Marhabo plans to use this loan to increase the amount of fruits and vegetables at her store.  She thanks Arvand in advance for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sara Nohemy

texts.es:
Sara es una joven de 27 años de edad ama de casa y agricultora madre de 2 hijos los cuales son menores de edad y aún no están en edad escolar. En compañía de su esposo se dedican al cultivo de café y malanga como también a la cría de cerdos lo cual es fortalecimiento para la economía de su hogar.  Principalmente ella se dedica al cultivo de malanga por lo que se ha dedicado a esta actividad por más de 3 años siendo su esposo quien le enseñara a trabajar ya que vio la necesidad de generar más ingresos para su familia y darles un mejor estilo de vida. El terreno donde está sembrada la malanga es propio el cual lo obtuvo gracias a una herencia por parte de su familia el cual está ubicado y dividido ya que ahí mismo esta su casa de habitación. Juntos trabajan para sacar a sus hijos adelante darles las comodidades que se merecen a pesar la humildad y la lucha continua que ejercen diariamente para que ellos nos les falte nada. 
sus metas y planes a futuro son los de seguir ampliando mediante la compra de nueva tierra para sembrar más de sus cultivos ya que la malanga ya que es un tubérculo el cual es muy utilizado en los negocios de comida y tiene mucha demanda entre otros productos que son buenos en su comercialización. Por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento para la siembra de nueva plantación de malanga mejorando el volumen de cultivo y al final de su cosecha mejorar también sus ingresos para seguir re invirtiendo.
texts.en:
Sara is a young woman aged 27, who is a housewife and a farmer. She is the mother of two young children who haven't yet reached school age. Her and her husband make a living growing coffee and taro, as well as rearing pigs, which are their livelihoods. She mainly works growing taro, and has done so for over three years. Her husband taught her how to do this after realising that they needed to earn more for their family, to offer them a better lifestyle. 

The land on which she grows the taro is her own, and came into her possession after she inherited it from her family. It is located in the same place as their home, and is divided up. Her and her husband work together to support their children and give them what they deserve, despite their modest means and how hard they have to fight every day to avoid going without.

Their future goals and plans are to continue to expand by buying new land to grow more crops, since taro is a tuber which is common in food shops and is in high demand, along with other products which sell well. For this reason, they are now requesting a loan to plant a new taro plantation, thereby improving their crop volume, and, after a improved harvest, their earnings too, so that they can continue to reinvest.

loans.use: to buy taro to plant.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Doña Sonia, tiene 54 años, esta casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Hace 8 años que se dedica al negocio de una pulpería donde ofrece refrescos, lácteos, churros, embutidos, carnes, arroz, frijoles, queso, mantequilla, pan, harina, manteca, etc. El préstamo que solicita es por 4,000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar en la compra de granos básicos, para la venta, como ser frijoles, maíz y arroz para la venta. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar los ingresos y a ofrecer mas productos a sus clientes. Su objetivo es poder generar sus ingresos y ayudar a cubrir los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sonia is 54 years old. She is married, has three children, and lives in the municipality of San Pedro Sula. She has had a small grocery store business for eight years, where she offers soft drinks, dairy products, snacks, cold cuts, meats, rice, beans, cheese, butter, bread, flour, lard, etc. 

The loan she is requesting is for 4,000 lempiras, and she is going to use it to purchase basic staples to sell, such as beans, corn and rice. This investment will help her to increase her income and offer more products to her customers. Her objective is to be able to generate her income and help cover the household expenses and her children's education.

loans.use: To buy basic staples such as beans, corn and rice to sell.

loans.name: Samawati Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her early thirties, is married with four children (three boys and a girl), who are enrolled in school. Since 2006, she has been running a retail shop, selling products like dry foods, phone airtime, and other products. Amina is also managing two businesses; one is selling water that she stores in a tank, and the other is a catering business.

Amina has employed few helpers. She starts working from 06:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m., or sometime to midnight if she has a catering activity to supply food. Amina is able to make a good profit per month.
 
From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her 14th loan request, which she will use to restock more missing products in her retail shop to resell. With the previous loans, all of which paid back successfully, she purchased more stock for her retail shop and bought new catering equipment, such as serving dishes.

Amina used her profit to cover school fees and household expenses. She also bought a land and reinvested back into her business. She dreams to be a known business person with a better life.
 
She will share this loan with her loan group, Samawati, which totals 6 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock more missing products in her retail shop to resell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 44-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with a nine-year-old daughter. For three years now, Imelda relies on home-cooked meals and snacks for an income. She usually cooks meat, vegetables, and snacks for her customers. 

She is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy sugar, bananas and noodles. She hopes that someday, with enough savings, she can further renovate her house for her family's comfort.

loans.use: to buy sugar, bananas, and noodles.

loans.name: Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Regina, who is in her mid thirties, is married with a boy who is in school. For three years now, Regina has been running a grocery business selling water, sodas, beers, juices and spirits. She is also selling bites, such as groundnuts, cashew nuts, and donuts. She starts working from mid day to 11 p.m. daily, and is able to make good returns per month.
 
This will be her 4th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Regina used her previous loans to purchase grocery stocks, such as beers, waters, spirits, and sodas, which resold to more people. She also made more bites that resold. Regina has paid back all her loans successfully, and with the business profit, she built a house and covered school fees and some home expenses. 

She will use this loan to buy more empty bottles and new demanded drinks, and restock the out-of-stock drinks. She dreams that one day she will be able to expand her business and sell more drinks. 

Regina will share this loan with her loan group" Sisi kwa Sisi," which consists of 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more empty bottles and new demanded drinks, and restock the out-of-stock drinks.

loans.name: Nzele

texts.en:
Nzele received his first Kiva loan that really changed his business. His income improved as a result of the loan. His farming business needs some money. He seeks a loan to buy farming tools and equipment. 

His motorcycle business is going on well, and he plans to add another motorcycle in future. The major challenge in the business is weather. He hopes that the business will grow and be able to improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy farming tools and equipment.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a soft-drink retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her soft-drink retailing business.

Emma has been in this business for twenty years and she earns more income from charcoal sales.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her soft-drink retailing business.

loans.name: Ma. Vanessa

texts.en:
Ma. Vanessa is 27 years old, from the municipality of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married, with two children ages five and four.  

For two years now, Ma. Vanessa has operated a sari-sari store where she sells snacks, candies, bread, detergent, canned goods, and soft drinks. She is also into seaweed farming. She barely earns an average income of PHP 6,000 that helps with her family’s basic needs. 

Ma. Vanessa is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy straw, seaweed seedlings, canned goods, toiletries, seasoning, and candies. She hopes that, someday, she can continue to improve and expand her business, for increased profits and in support of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy straw, seaweed seedlings, canned goods, toiletries, seasoning, and candies.

loans.name: Hortalizas Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socias exitosas una de ellas es Nury tiene la edad de 35 años, soltera, su negocio es la venta de leche en su domicilio desde hace 11 años, El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de leche para la elaboración de cuajada, leche agria. Dalila mujer de 43 años su negocio es la venta de especies en Tipitapa desde hace 14 años y  Marling mujer de 27 años su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
El grupo lo conforman tres socias exitosas una de ellas es Nury tiene la edad de 35 años, soltera, su negocio es la venta de leche en su domicilio desde hace 11 años, El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de leche para la elaboración de cuajada, leche agria. Dalila mujer de 43 años su negocio es la venta de especies en Tipitapa desde hace 14 años y  Marling mujer de 27 años su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace 2 años. 

The group is made of of three successful members. One of them is Nury, who is 35 and single. She has had a business selling milk from her home for the last 11 years. She is seeking the loan in order to buy milk for the preparation of curds and buttermilk.

Dalila, a 43-year-old woman, has had a business selling spices in Tipitapa for 14 years and Marling, a 27-year-old woman, has been running a convenience store in her home for the last two years.

loans.use: to buy milk in order to prepare curds and buttermilk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is at the age of 43, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has to work hard to feed her family. She is the mother of 2 sons and 3 daughters. 
Her husband is a vagabond and does not understand his responsibilities towards his family.

To manage her household expenses, she owns a small tailoring business, with the help of her daughters, at her home. Parveen and her daughters have been sewing cloths for many years now. Her daughter grown young. Her daughter has been helping and learning tailoring arts with her, and now she has gotten a lot of experience. Parveen wants to buy a used Juki machine for her so that she can contribute to her income.

Therefore, Parveen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her daughter can do some extra tailoring work and contribute to the monthly income.
 
Parveen wants to make some savings so that she can arrange the marriage ceremony of her daughters. 
Parveen says thanks to Kiva and its' field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her daughter.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal's age is 57 years, and she is married with five children, three of whom are still in school. She lives in the rural village of the Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, earning a living through raising pigs and selling rice soup. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR 64,000 per day from the current business, and can save about KHR 24,000 each day for future needs.

Phal has been with VisionFund for four cycles. Now she is applying for an education loan to cover the entire tuition fee for four years for her daughter, a 20-year-old freshman, at a local university, specializing in Accounting. 

She highly hopes that this loan will enable her to send her daughter to the university, and help her obtain a higher education background to end up with a good job after graduation, in order to support the family.

loans.use: to cover the entire tuition fee for four years for her daughter at a local university.

loans.name: Esperanza Y Amor Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “ESPERANZA Y AMOR”  se encuentran muy contentas de estar pasando el 02 ciclo. Juana tiene 51 años solteros con una hija de 16 años educando. Juana se dedica a la venta de verduras tubérculos en un mercado actividad que aprendió desde muy joven que en la actualidad le genera ingresos económicos y el sustento de la educación de su hija. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de tubérculos y verduras. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Juana es la tercera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
The members of the  “ESPERANZA Y AMOR”  group are very pleased to have entered their second cycle. Juana is 51 years old, single and the mother of a 16 year old daughter who is in school. Juana sells root vegetables in a market. It is something she learned when she was very young. Today this activity generates the revenues needed for her household and for her daughter's education. 

Juana will use the loan to buy root vegetables and other vegetables. The group thanks the lenders at Kiva for granting this loan. Juana is the third person from the left.

loans.use: to buy tubers and vegetables

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 33 years old. He is single, and has been in the maize farming business for the past four years. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production: they need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry lives in Mariakani area nears Mombasa Kenya. He is 26 years old and he started a small grocery store in his neighborhood from the savings he made. He knew Milango through friends and now he seeks a loan to buy four crates of tomatoes, a sack of kale and cabbages for the business. He hopes that the business will grow to become a successful store in the next five years despite the challenges of price changes and inflation. He will use the income he will raise to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy stock for his grocery store

loans.name: 05.01.02 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Lạc operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make food to sell. Lạc has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Lạc is 62 years old and she is married with 3 children. Lạc lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province; her children are grown up.

Lạc is the group leader of the 05.01.02 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. This is Lạc's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Lạc hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make food to sell.

loans.name: Donatille

texts.en:
Donatille is 51 years old. She is a mother of two children ages 13 and 17. She has spent 20 years as a farmer. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Chem, a rural villager from Stoeng Sen province's Kampong Thorm district, is 28 years old and single. Chem has been working in one company in the village. She has been in the job for almost one year and she is able to earn about US $5 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is the first-cycle loan for Chem with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She is applying for an education loan to cover her entire tuition fee for four years in a local university, specializing in Management. She highly hopes that this loan will enable her to attend university and also help her to obtain a higher education background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to cover her entire tuition fee

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida is a 38-year-old woman, living with her four children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw but has to pay a daily rental because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He is not a landlord; he has to feed his children three times a day, as well as meet educational expenses and utility bills. Now his children are growing older, with a rapid increase in their needs. 

He has worried for many days about how to abstain from the daily rental, so he decided to buy his own rickshaw. He saved for a long time to buy a new auto rickshaw, but at the time of purchasing some money still remained short.

Therefore, Sajida has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw, together with his savings.  She hopes that now her husband will no longer have to pay the rent, which will mean an increase in income. 

Sajida is very happy after taking this loan and says thank you to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw for her husband to drive.

loans.name: Alba Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Alba del Carmen tiene 51 años de edad es madre soltera de cinco hijos de los cuales 3 viven fuera del país y solo 2 viven con ella los cuales se involucran en todas las actividades del campo que se realizan para que sus cultivos de café se mantengan en perfectas condiciones. Ella es ama de casa y agricultora con un grado de educación primaria completa ya que como madre de familia, mujer emprendedora y trabajadora vela por el bienestar de su familia por lo que también tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación con la que también genera un poco más de ingresos para su hogar. El terreno que ella trabaja en compañía de sus hijos es propio el cual obtuvo gracias a la buena administración de sus ganancias y que hoy en día agradece a DIOS la oportunidad de tenerlo el cual está a una distancia de 8 minutos trasladándose a pie diariamente para su asistencia. 
Actualmente su meta es preparar un pedazo de tierra en el cual tiene cultivo viejo re sembrarlo con la adquisición de nueva chapola y darle un mejor uso para poder aprovechar esa tierra que no está generando la utilidad que debería. Por lo que hoy ha solicitado un financiamiento para la compra de fertilizante, abono, foliares entre otros que serán de gran ayuda para abonar sus cultivos de café actuales y también utilizar otra parte para mejorar la tierra que tiene sin actividad.
texts.en:
Alba del Carmen is 51 years old. She is a single mother of five children. Three of them live outside the country. The two others live with her and are involved in all the field activities that are necessary for their coffee crops to remain in perfect condition. Alba del Carmen is a housewife and a farmer. She has a degree in Primary Education. 

As the mother of a family and a hard-working, enterprising woman she ensures the well-being of her family. She also has a small store in her residence which generates some more income for the family. The land she works along with her children is hers. She got this through good management of her revenues and today she thanks God for the opportunity to have it. It is an eight minute walk from her house to the land. 

Her present goal is to prepare a piece of land, which is now old-growth. She wants to replant it with young coffee plants in order to make the land more useful as the land is not producing the profits it should. To this end Alba del Carmen is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, manure, foliar sprays, etc. which will be a great help in fertilizing her coffee plants and she will use another part of the loan to improve the land that is not in use.

loans.use: to buy supplies needed to prepare and fertilize her crops and  to prepare land to cultivate.

loans.name: Esperence

texts.en:
Esperence is 49 years old. She has four children between ages 3 and 15 years. They all go to school. She will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizers during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer to increase production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labor costs and to buy fertilizers during maize production.

loans.name: Marjourie Jaqueline

texts.es: La joven Marjourie Jaqueline de 24 años de edad, es soltera y habita en Managua, se encuentra estancada en su crecimiento profesional por no disponer de recursos económicos para continuar estudiando. Actualmente no trabaja y la única actividad que realiza son sus estudios universitarios, quien con mucho esfuerzo se los pagado su mamá. Marjourie está segura que un buen profesional tiene que crecer en conocimientos y actualización, porque le permite competir entre los muchos profesionales desempleados en el país. Ella solicita su crédito, para realizar post- grado en administración turística y hotelera, ya que su mayor sueño es culminarla, trabajar y apoyar a otros integrantes de su familia.
texts.en: The young Marjourie Jaqueline is 24-years-old, single, lives in Managua, and has stalled in her professional growth due to lack of financial resources for further study. She is currently not working and her only activities are her university studies which are paid for by her mother's great effort. Marjourie is confident that a good professional has to grow in knowledge and adapt because it allows him or her to compete among the many unemployed professionals in the country. She requests your loan to realize her graduate studies in hotel and tourism management. Her biggest dream is to finish her studies, work, and support other family members.

loans.use: to realize her graduate studies in hotel and tourism management.

loans.name: Ardinugroho

texts.en:
Ardi runs a small stall. He sells groceries, snacks and mobile phone airtime credits and processes bill payments. Ardi lives in Cilegon, a semi urban area about three hours from Jakarta. He is married.

Ardi began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income and business by selling mobile airtime and processing bill payments. He feels really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments. For the last  month, he has made around $5 to $10 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). Recently, he took out a loan to get a printer from Kiva to support his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: to purchase a printer to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung was born in 1993. He lives in Bac Ninh Province, Vietnam. He is a mechanic major at Thai Nguyen University (http://www.tnu.edu.vn/Pages/home.aspx). His course lasts 60 months, and he will be graduated in 2016. His education’s fee is subsidized by his parents. 

Hung plans to find a part-time job to have money to pay his education’s fee. Hung’s family has five members. (His mother appears with him in the posted photo.) He is the first person in his family to have a higher education. His mother grows rice, and his father is a construction worker to earn a living. His family’s income is about VND 5,000,000 per month. 

Hung has a passion with his major because he is aware of this major as suitable for his ability. He wants to follow till the end of this university’s course. He understands that learning will give him opportunities to get a high-paid job and repay his parents. 

He wants to borrow VND 15,300,000 to pay his education’s fee. Through this program, he wants to tell people that he appreciates the help of people all around the world who have contributed to this kind of program. It has contributed a lot to the education of him individually and of the Vietnamese youth generation in general.

loans.use: to pay his education’s fee.

loans.name: Hass

texts.en:
From Baray district, Kampong Thom province, Hass has been working in the farming sector more than thirty years alongside her husband. She is now 61 years old and has five children, three married and two single. Some married children who are currently living under the same roof with her often share their income to financially support the family and cover their living expenses according to the real demand.

The main purpose of using the Kiva loan is to hire domestic laborers to cut unwanted plants and remove weeds from her cassava plantation, so she can allow her cultivated plants to grow freely. With the help of the loan, she hopes to have an abundant harvest, which she will sell in the market for a good profit. Thanks to lenders for the support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to hire domestic laborers to cut unwanted plants and remove weeds from her cassava plantation.

loans.name: Koudy

texts.fr: Madame Koudy est une femme brave qui évolue dans la vente de draps et des rideaux. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Koudy a une expérience de plus de 20ans dans son activité. Comme charges principales, elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarités de ses enfants. Elle a besoin de ce prêt pour acheter d’autres draps et renforcer son stock de marchandises. Elle aime satisfaire sa clientèle qui habite dans son quartier. Koudy commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h, à l’avenir elle souhaite avoir une autonomie financière et n’aura plus besoin de crédits pour faire son activité.
texts.en:
Koudy is a brave woman who is in the business of selling sheets and curtains. She is married and a mother of a family. She has more than 20 years of experience in her business. Her primary responsibilities are to help her husband with the daily expenses and with the schooling costs for her children.

Koudy needs this loan to purchase more sheets and to replenish her stock of merchandise. She likes meeting the needs of her customers, who live in her neighborhood. Koudy begins her day at 8am and works until 6pm. In the future she hopes to have financial independence and to no longer need loans in order to run her business.

loans.use: to purchase sheets and curtains for resale

loans.name: Silvia  Raquel

texts.es: Silvia tiene la edad de  23 años, acompañada, con dos hijos menores, su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio desde hace 4 años, tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año, tiempo en el cual ha demostrado ser una mujer muy trabajadora y cumplida en sus cuotas. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, jabón de baño, jabón de lavar trastes, jabón de lavar ropa, papel higiénico, fósforos, café, sal, productos lácteos, gaseosas.
texts.en: Silvia is 23 years old with a common-law spouse and two young children. Her business is a general store located in her home for the last four years. She has been a client of the institution for one year, time in which she has proven to be a hardworking woman, up to date on her bills. This loan is requested to buy basic goods like rice, sugar, oil, beans, bath soap, dish soap, laundry soap, toilet paper, matches, coffee, salt, dairy products, and soda.

loans.use: to buy basic goods like rice, sugar, oil, beans, bath soap, dish soap, laundry soap, toilet paper, matches, coffee,salt, dairy products, and soda.

loans.name: Marieme Diagana

texts.fr:
Agée de 41 ans, madame Marième s’active depuis 5ans dans la vente de prêt à porter pour enfants. Elle a fait parti d’un groupement ou elle à bénéficier d’un crédit de 50000F CFA. Compte tenu de la possibilité d’emprunter une somme plus consistante en ouvrant un compte individuel, elle a préférer  l’ouvrir  pour demander un montant de 400.000F CFA.
Avec ce prêt, elle va acheter  des robes, tee-shirt, chaussures pour revendre à ses clients qui font la commande avant qu’elle ne fasse le déplacement. Elle ne supporte aucune charge mais veut quand même améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille en donnant un coup de main à son époux qui gère la dépense journalière. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour revenir à la maison vers les environs de 20h.
texts.en:
Marième is 41 years old and has been in the business of selling children's ready-to-wear clothing for 5 years. She is a member of a group that received a loan for 50,000 francs CFA. In the hopes of obtaining a larger loan as an individual, she chose to request a loan herself of 400,000 francs CFA. With this loan, she will purchase dresses, t shirts, and shoes to resell to her customers who place the orders before the procures the items.

Marième does not have anyone in her care but still wants to improve her own living conditions by helping her husband, who is in charge of the daily expenses. She begins her day at 8am and returns home around 8pm.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear clothing for children and resell it

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Madame Yacine est une dame agée de 27 ans qui est mariée et mère d’une fille de 2ans. Elle habite à coté du Guichet et évolue dans le commerce de produits divers comme le sucre, lait,  huile, savon etc…….Yacine a une expérience de plus de 5ans dans son activité. Elle sollicite ce prêt d’un montant de 100.000F pour renforcer son fond de roulement afin d’augmenter son stock de marchandises. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18 h. A l’avenir elle souhaite avoir lune grande boutique pour augmenter ses revenus. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Yacine is a 27-year-old woman who is married and the mother of a 2-year-old daughter. She lives next to the lending branch and is in the business of selling various products, such as sugar, milk, oil, soap, etc. She has more than 5 years of experience in this business.

Yacine is requesting this loan for 100,000 francs CFA to increase her turnover by supplementing her stock of merchandise. She begins her day at 8am and works until 6pm. In the future she hopes to have a large shop to increase her profits. She helps her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase various products like milk, sugar, soap, and rice for resale

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба очень трудолюбивый человек. Она родилась 1957 году в городе Исфаре Республики Таджикистан. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Имеет среднее образование. У нее свой собственный бизнес. Матлуба предоставляет услуги шитья женских одежд и  продает их. Ее муж работает в комбинате строительных материалов. Один из сыновей находится в трудовой миграции в РФ. Ее невестка также помогает ему в ее деятельности. Матлуба очень любит свою деятельность и хочет расширить свой бизнес. Она планирует закупить ткани для пошива женской одежды но у нее нету на руках достаточно денежных средств. Поэтому, она обратилась в Арванд за кредитом. С Арванд она сотрудничает с 2010 года и считает, что именно это организация посодействовала ей развивать ее деятельность по бизнесу в период сотрудничества.  Выражает благодарность Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Matluba is a very hardworking person. She was born in 1957 in the city of Isfara, Tajikistan. She is married and has four children. She has a high school education. She owns her own business. Matluba provides sewing services and sells women's clothes. Her husband works in a mill producing building materials. One of their sons is a migrant worker in Russia. Her daughter-in-law also helps out with the business.

Matluba loves her work very much and wants to expand the business. She plans to buy fabrics to sew women's clothing, but she doesn't have sufficient capital. For this reason, she applied for a loan with Arvand. She has been working with Arvand since 2010 and believes that the organization has allowed her to expand the business during the time that they've worked together. She is grateful to Arvand for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: 01.05.08 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Quyết has a manufacturing business sewing clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to provide tailor-made and clothing repairing service.

Quyết is 44 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 01.05.08 Đông Sơn solidarity group.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents

In 2011, Quyết joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Quyết has been involved in her business for 5 years.  The main harship that Quyết faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Quyết hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to buy machines for sewing

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Although he has received no prior formal education, Emmanuel is an entrepreneur. He specializes in selling groceries in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for six years. Emmanuel is married and has six children. His wife works as a trader. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Emmanuel wants to use his loan to increase his current inventory levels, hence allowing him to sell greater quantities of groceries. In the long term, Emmanuel plans to reinvest future profits into his business, thus helping him expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: buy inventory for his grocery store

loans.name: 01.05.01 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Liên operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to make processed food to sell.

Liên is 47 years old.  She is married and has 2 children.  She is the group leader of the 01.05.01 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 5 members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependent.

In 2006, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Liên has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  

Liên has been involved in her business for 4 years.  The main harship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.  In the future, Liên hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find  good jobs.

loans.use: buy vegetables to make food to sell

loans.name: Furaha Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Leonard, who is in her early 40s, is married and has three children who are still going to school.  She has been running several businesses selling cooked food and cold drinks like sodas, beer,  juices, water, wine and spirits for four years now.  She works from 8 am to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Leonard's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to restock the missing items in her cold drinks store and in food store.  She has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  

Leonard will use this loan to buy more sodas, juices, beer, wines, spirits, rice, maize flour, meat, chicken and more Irish potatoes for making chips.  She dreams of building a guest house.

Leonard will share this loan with her loan group "Furaha Tegeta", which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: buy food and drink items to sell

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh was born in 1993. She lives in Dong Anh. She is studying for a nursing major at Ha Noi Medical College (http://www.yhn.edu.vn/). Her course lasts 36 months and she will graduate in 2015. Her educational fee is subsidized by her parents.   Oanh plans to find a part-time job to earn more money to pay for her educational fee.  

Oanh’s family has six members. She is the first person in her family to graduate from highschool and to study in the university. Her mother is a worker and her father grows rice to earn a living. Her mother is with her in the posted photo. 

Oanh's family income is about 15,000,000 VND per month.  She is passionate about her major because she is aware that this major is suitable for her personality. She wants to care for everyone's health. She wants to follow through to the end of this university’s course. She understands that learning helps  her have opportunities to get a high-paid job to afford to help her parents. 

Oanh wants to borrow 15,300,000 VND to pay for her educational fee. After graduating, she wishes to find a high-paid job to improve her family’s living standards and contribute her efforts to social development. Through this program, she wants to tell people that she appreciates the help of people all around the world who have contributed to this kind of program. This has supported a lot her education individually and the Vietnamese’s youth generation in general.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in Kaloleni area near Mariakani, Kenya. She is 43 years old and married with four children. She has been selling fried potatoes at the market for more than five years now and the business has been growing. She joined Milangi through friends who invited her to join so that she can save and be able to access credit for her business.  

Alice now seeks a loan to buy cooking oil, a sack of potatoes and food colouring for her business. She hopes that she will build the business in to a cafe in the future, despite the challenge of price changes. She will use the income that she will raise to buy a piece of land and build a residential home for her family.

loans.use: buy oil, potatoes and food coloring

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Ny, 47, lives with her husband and three children in a village in the Battambang province of Sangke district, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been selling bean sprouts and Chinese noodles while her husband helps to earn more income by working as a paid worker. Together, Ny and her husband can earn about 125,000 KHR per day but they can manage to save about 23,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

Ny has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for six loan cycles and have completely paid back the loans. With the loans from VisionFund, she has managed to improve her livelihood. She is now leading her group to ask for a new loan.  Ny is going to use her portion to buy more Chinese noodles to resale. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: buy Chinese noodles to sell

loans.name: 11-02-03 Trường Thi Group

texts.en:
Liên is applying for a loan to purchase vegetables to resell. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables.

Liên is 43 years old and is married with 3 children.  Liên is the group leader of the 11-02-03 Trường Thi solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 

Liên supports 1 dependent with her business in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.  Her 2 other children are grown up.

This is Liên first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  She has been involved in her business for 5 years.  The main harship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Muqadas

texts.en:
Muqadas is a 48-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.   She has requested a loan for her husband’s fruit selling business. Her husband has been selling fruits for many years.  He sells seasonal fresh fruits in his hometown. He uses a four-wheel manual cart for selling fruits.  Being a hawker, he can easily reach near to the people. The people like to buy fruits at their doors instead of having to go towards the market. Due to the fruit’s freshness and reasonable rates, he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

Due to his reputation the demand for fruits has increased.  Muqadas is taking loan for her husband so that her husband would be able to buy fruits in more quantity.  Muqadas feels proud of her husband and appreciates his efforts for his family. Muqadas wants to save the excess profit amount so that she can  utilize these savings for future sudden needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: buy fruits to sell

loans.name: 11-02-02 Trường Thi Group

texts.en:
