Mrs. Lan has a retail business, selling dry food and general things. She is requesting a loan to purchase dry food and general things to resell.

Lan is 58 years old and married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 11-02-02 Trường Thi solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province with no dependents; her children are grown up.

This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Lan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Lan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to remodel her house, and for her children to find a good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase dry food and general thing to resell.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy, de 19 años es un joven soltero, trabajador e hijo ejemplar. Vive en compañía de sus padres y hermanos a los que apoya en la casa de sus padres desde que nació. Desde hace 3 años, cuando terminó de estudiar la secundaría comenzó a apoyar a su padre en las labores del hogar, es así que como todo hombre de campo aprendió a administrar el capital para la siembra de tubérculos, además de la negociación de las cosechas, pero como él es un joven dinámico y con muchas ganas de salir adelante convenció a su padre en vender por ellos mismos la carne de sus animales, ahora juntos abrieron un espacio en el mercado de carnes de la zona donde comercializan la carne todos los días, “nos va muy bien en muestro negocio, sobre todo porque nuestros animales son 100% naturales y los criamos nosotros mismos”, comenta. Ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos aumentar su ganado y ahorrar para estudiar una carrera universitaria.  Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero otorgado, este le ayudará en el progreso de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Freddy, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de animales menores para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en: Freddy is 19 years old, single, hardworking and an exemplary son. He lives with his parents and siblings and has supported the home since he was born. Three years ago, when he finished high school, he started helping his father with household tasks. That is how all famers learn how to handle the capital to plant tubers and negotiate the harvest. But since he is a dynamic young man with a strong desire to move up in life, he convinced his father to sell the meat from small animals themselves, and now they have a space in the meat market together and sell their meat every day. "Our business is going very well, especially because our animals are 100 percent natural and we raise them ourselves," Freddy said. Now he wants to expand his livestock and save for a college degree. This is his first loan with Kiva, and he is grateful for the financial support to help his business make progress. He promises to make his payments on time. Freddy plans to use the loan to purchase small animals to continue his business.

loans.use: to purchase small animals.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es: Primitiva, de 37 años, está casada con Sergio, su esposo. Ambos tienen 2 hijos con quienes viven en su casa propia.  “Me siento feliz de poder continuar con mis objetivos, a paso firme”, afirma muy contenta. El principal trabajo de Primitiva, es la compra y venta de animales menores como: cerdos, gallinas, ovejas y cuyes, los que engorda para luego revenderlos en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma. Pero hace un año, compró un auto con el que realiza trasporte público; en esté negocio, Primitiva obtuvo muy buenos resultados, pues según menciona; existe poco acceso a los poblados lejanos de la localidad, donde la mayoría de sus habitantes necesita trasladarse a la ciudad para comprar víveres, comestibles y negociar sus cultivos y demás trabajos independientes que realizan. Por ello, hace poco concretó la compra de una movilidad más, con el que está adquiriendo más ganancias, pero continúa ahorrando ya que se quedó sin capital de trabajo por su nueva adquisición. Este es su sexto crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero otorgado, este le ayudará en el progreso de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Primitiva; invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de varios animales menores para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en: Primitiva is 37 years old and married to Sergio, with whom she has two children. They all live together in a home they own. "I am happy to be able to continue with my goals (with) a firm step," she says contently. Primitiva's main job is buying and selling small animals like pigs, chickens, sheep and guinea pigs, which she fattens and then resells at the central market in the city of Tarma. But a year ago she bought a car to offer transportation services. Primitiva has seen very good results in this business because, as she mentions, there is limited access to the faraway villages outside of town, from where the majority of the inhabitants need to travel to purchase food, sell their crops or carry out work. Therefore, she recently purchased another vehicle with which she is making more profits, but she continues to save since the new acquisition left her without any capital. This is her sixth loan cycle with Kiva, and she is grateful for the financial support to help her make progress with her business. She promises to make her payments on time. With the loan, Primitiva plans to purchase various small animals to continue her livestock business.

loans.use: to purchase animals such as pigs, chickens, sheep and others.

loans.name: Alma Lorena

texts.es: Alma de 51 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace 18 años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Doña Alma solicita un crédito para comprar maíz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en: Alma, age 51, works selling tortillas out of her home. For the past 18 years she has worked Monday through Sunday, and she has a lot of customers since she is a very friendly and hardworking person. With the earnings she has obtained she has managed to pay the cost of her home. She lives in her own house with her husband and two children. Alma requests a loan to buy corn by the quintal to continue making tortillas, and make greater profits to have better economic stability with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal.

loans.name: Madinabonu

texts.ru: Мадинабону умелая швея в возрасте 31 года. Она замужем, имеет одну дочь и проживает со своей семьей в городе Вахдат. Муж Мадинабону работает наемным рабочим, дочь учится в школе. Сама Мадинабону последние 5 лет занимается швейным делом. Она принимает заказы на шитье женских национальных платьев. В среднем за день она вышивает по одному платью и по запросу своих клиенток она больше всего шьет платья с вышивками, потому что сегодня такие платья в моде. Для улучшения и расширения своей работы Мадинабону просит кредит, чтобы купить компьютерную швейную машинку. С помощью такой машинки она будет справляться с заказами быстро и за день будет вышивать по два платья. Это увеличит ее доход и естественно улучшит финансовое положение ее семьи.
texts.en: Madinabonu is a 31 year old skilled seamstress. She is married, has one daughter and lives with her family in the city of Vahdat. Madinabonu's husband is a wage worker and her daughter is in school. Madinabonu has worked for five years in the sewing business. She takes orders for sewing women's national dresses. On average she embroiders one dress a day and by request of her clients she mostly sews dresses with embroidery, because it is today's dress fashion. To improve and expand her work Madinabonu is requesting a loan to buy a computerized sewing machine. With the help of this machine she will be able to cope with the speed of the orders and in one day sew two dresses. This will increase her income and naturally improve the finances of her family.

loans.use: To buy a computerized sewing machine to grow her garment business

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 38 años, está casada con Clemente. Ambos tienen 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Hace 10 años que está trabajadora mujer, se dedica a la agricultura; sus principales sembríos constan de papa, el cual después de cuidarlo y abonarlo constantemente, lo vende en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que le molesta a Norma, son las constantes plagas que invaden sus cultivos, pero gracias a su experiencia ella está logrando salir adelante, su objetivo es tener cada día sembríos de mejor calidad. Paralelamente a sus cultivos, ella se dedica al cuidado de, sus 20 cabezas de ganado vacuno, los cuales enseba para después revenderlos. “Mi objetivo, es sacar adelante a mis hijos, y brindarles una buena educación”, afirma. Este es su sexto crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero otorgado, este le ayudará en el progreso de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Norma, invertirá los S/.300 en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Norma is 38 years old and married to Clemente, with whom she has four children. They all live together in a home they own. For the past 10 years this hardworking mother has made a living in agriculture. Her main crop is potatoes, which she tends to and fertilizes constantly before selling at the central market in the city of Tarma. What bothers Norma are the constant plagues that invade her crops, but thanks to her experience she has been able to make headway. Her goal is to have high-quality harvests every day. Along with her crops, she also makes a living caring for 20 heads of cattle, fattening them to later resell. "My goal is to make headway for my children and provide them with a good education," she says. This is her sixth loan with Kiva, and she is grateful for the financial support to help make progress with her business. She promises to make her payments on time. Norma plans to use the loan to purchase organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 41 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, él se dedica a la venta y  cultivo de café desde hace 13 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, ya tiene clientela establecida que lo prefieren por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, Juan esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herbicidas, abonos, etc. para poder seguir con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is 41 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and their two children. He has worked selling and cultivating coffee for 13 years. He sells his products in the different markets that are located near his house.He already has an established base of customers who prefer him for the quality of his product and good prices. 

Juan is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, compost, etc. in order to be able to continue with his farming, as this is his only source of work, and therefore, of giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, compost, etc.

loans.name: Kenni Oswaldo

texts.es: Kenni  de 32 años de edad se dedica a la venta y elaboración de dulces de coco y miel desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en tiendas que ya tiene establecidas y que lo prefieren por la calidad del producto y buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, Kenni esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: coco, azúcar, miel, bolsas, etc. para producir mas y tener mejores ganancias, para poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Kenni is 32 years old. He has worked for several years selling and preparing candy made from coconut and honey. He sells his products in stores that he already has established himself with, and who prefer him for the quality of his product and good prices. With what he obtains from his sales, he is able to cover some household costs. He lives in his own house with his wife and their three children. Kenni is requesting a loan for the purchase of basic ingredients like: coconut, sugar, honey, bags, etc. to increase production and have better earnings, in order to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase basic ingredients like: coconut, sugar, honey, bags, etc.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Abena is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves). She usually sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ for six years.

Abena is married and has seven children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Abena wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increase her current inventory levels. This will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Kenkey’. 

In the long term, Abena plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increase her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock lives in Changamwe in Mombasa, Kenya. He is a 38-year-old married business man with three children. He runs a food cafe in town. He started the business two years ago and it has been growing for sometime. He managed to employ three people in the business, who help him run the business.

He hopes that the business will grow into a full restaurant within the next five years despite the challenge of price changes. He knew Milango through friends who invited him to join so that he can save and be able to access funding for the business.

He now seeks a loan to buy food stuff such as flour and vegetables for the business. He will use the extra income to educate his children and give them a better life.

loans.use: to buy food stuff such as flour and vegetables.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 35 years old. He is a father of two children, ages between 5 and 7; all his children are enrolled in schools. He will use Kiva loan to support labor costs, and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers, and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Dang

texts.en:
Dang was born in 1995. He lives in Bac Ninh province, Vietnam. He learns engineering construction as a major at Water Resources University (http://www.wru.edu.vn/). His courses last 60 months, and he will be graduating in 2018. 

His education fees are subsidized by his parents. Dang plans to find a part-time job to have more money to pay for his education fees. Dang’s family has six members. His mother had taken the posted photo with him. He is the second person in his family to graduate high school and have a higher education.

His parents grow rice to earn a living. Dang has a passion for his major. He understands that learning helps him have opportunities to get a high-paying job to afford for his parents, so he wants to follow till the end of this university’s courses. 

He wants to borrow 15,300,000 VND to pay for his education fees. Through this program, he wants to tell people that he appreciates the help of people all around the world who have contributed to this kind of program. This has been supportive a lot for his education individually, and for the Vietnamese youth generation in general.

loans.use: to pay for his education fees.

loans.name: Kwesi

texts.en: Even though Kwesi grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped him from fulfilling his dream of achieving a better life for himself and his family. Currently Kwesi is an entrepreneur. He sells charcoal in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). His business enterprise has grown substantially since he began six years ago. He uses the income from his business to help his wife raise their two children. Kwesi has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for his product. Nevertheless he is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus he aims to use his loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kwesi wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all his children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto, de 28 años, está casado con Haydee. Ambos tienen 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Alberto se dedica a la agricultura. Sus principales cultivos constan de tubérculos como: papa y oyuco, “mis padres me enseñaron todo lo necesario, sobre las técnicas de cultivo”, menciona. Los buenos cuidados que le ofrece constantemente a sus sembríos, hacen que sus cosechas sean buenas y con mucha demanda en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma. Ya tiene 11 años dedicándose a está ardua labor y ahora no solo sigue sembrando, también compró varias cabezas de ganado ovino, los que están creciendo fuertes y saludables. Según cuenta la venta de los mismos ayuda en algunos gastos eventuales que tiene, ya que compra a un precio muy bajo con la intensión de engordarlos y vender a uno mayor. Seguro de la voluntad y la fuerza que tiene, ahora él está invirtiendo mayor dinero en la mejora de sus cultivos. Éste es su sexto crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero otorgado, este le ayudará en el progreso de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Alberto, invertirá los S/.1200 en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Alberto is 28 years old. He is married to Haydee; together, they have 2 children who live with them in their own house. Alberto works in agriculture. His main crops consist of tubers such as potato and oyuco (a root vegetable). 

“My parents taught me everything that is necessary about farming techniques,” he says.

The excellent care that he constantly gives to his crops makes his harvests good and in great demand at the central market in the city of Tarma. He already has 11 years of doing this hard labor, and now, he doesn’t just farm. He also purchased several head of sheep, which he is raising strong and healthy. He says that selling them helps with incidental household costs that he has, because he buys them at a very low price with the intention of fattening them and selling them at a better price. 

This is his sixth loan with Kiva, for which he is very grateful for the financial support offered to him. This will aid him in the progress of his business. In addition, he promises to be punctual with his quota payments. Alberto will invest the S/.1200 in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish his crops.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Loekheang

texts.en:
Loekheang is a citizen from a rural area located in Kandal Province’s Sa Ang District. Loekheang is 56 years old. To make a living, she has been selling grocery items for 38 years. The current business earns her about US$8 per day to meet the family’s need. 

Loekheang has been a member with Kiva partner, VisionFund, for five cycles. Loekheang successfully paid back the past loan, which has helped her to better support her family. She is now requesting an education loan to pay the tuition fees for the four years of her son’s bachelor degree program majoring in Law. This loan will enable her to send her son to university.

Loekheang hopes that her children will have a good and bright future from these academic studies and earn a better living in the future.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Valerio

texts.en:
Valerio is a 54-year-old man from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He is married with 8 children. The youngest is 13. 

Valerio runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells various items like noodles, sugar, cooking oil, coffee, shampoo, and condiments. He started his business 10 years ago. He is asking for a loan to buy more stock like canned goods, biscuits, beverages, and fertilizer.

In the future, Valerio hopes to expand his retail store business and increase business profitability for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more stock like canned goods, biscuits, beverages, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es: Luis de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable, no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a esta institución para solicitar un crédito ya que la temporada en la que se realiza la siembra, se aproxima, y quiere estar preparado con los principales insumos agrícolas como: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas,  etc.  Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Luis is 44 years old. He lives in his own house with his life partner. He works farming corn, beans and sorghum. This is how he makes his living and brings the daily bread to his home. He works at farming year after year. He is a very hardworking and responsible man; he does not tire of working and giving the best to his family. 

He has made the decision to join this organization to request a loan because the harvest season is coming up, and he wants to be prepared with his main agricultural supplies such as: fertilizer, poison for pests, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, etc. He hopes to have favorable results, because he has no other source of earnings. He trusts in God that he will succeed in getting an abundant harvest, which will allow him to continue bringing in the daily bread to his home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, poison for pests, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 36 years old. She is married with five children, they all go to school. She has been a maize farmer for the past 4 years. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Even though Margaret grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Margaret is an entrepreneur. She sells biscuits and cookies in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began three years ago. Margaret is married and has three children. Her husband works as a teacher. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Margaret wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of biscuits. In the long term, Margaret plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of biscuits.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 26 years old. She is married with two children. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production; she needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase the production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support the labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Despite growing up in poverty without a formal education, Elizabeth is an entrepreneur. She sells jewelry in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. She is married, and her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business help her and her husband to raise their three children. 

Elizabeth has identified that there is growing demand among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more jewelry to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 41 years old. He has four children aged between 3 and 16. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support the labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Adwowa did not have access to any formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Adwowa sells charcoal in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about three years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have three children. Adwowa uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Adwowa will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of charcoal, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Adwowa wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of charcoal, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials like nail polish, brushes and various nail colors

loans.name: Rasheeda's Group

texts.en:
Rasheeda is a young and kind 52-year-old woman. She is married and has three children. Her husband is very hardworking and loves his family very much. He is involved in his own business in order to have a regular income for the family. He is involved in manufacturing and selling furniture such as single beds, tables, etc. He started this business many years ago. He loves his work and does his work with fondness even in his old age. Her husband had previously obtained loans for his business. Now he has his third loan. Today, he has many regular customers and takes orders from other cities. This business yields a good income for him, but his family's needs are increasing day by day and he needs to earn more money. Now he wants to buy more raw materials for making furniture in order to expand his business.
 
Therefore, Rasheeda came to BRAC Pakistan and showed her wish to obtain a loan to buy raw materials such as planks and chipboard for marking furniture. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for business as well as for her family.

Rasheeda says thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as planks, chipboard, nails etc for making furniture.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Abena is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling soap in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for eight years. Abena is married and has six children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Abena wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of soap. In the long term, Abena plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell

loans.name: Baptiste

texts.en:
Baptiste is 31 years old. He is married with three children. He has spent five years in the business. He will use his Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizers during his maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs

loans.name: 11-02-05 Trường Thi Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa has a manufacturing business making wood furniture. She is requesting a loan to purchase more material to make wood furniture. Hoa is 52 years old and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a six-member group, the 11-02-01 Trường Thi solidarity group. Hoa supports two dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hoa has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hoa hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more material to make wood furniture.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling Banku (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste). She usually sells her Banku in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling Banku for six years.  Efua is married and has five children.  Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Efua wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty Banku’. In the long term, Efua plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and pig vitamins

loans.name: Luz Argelia

texts.es:
Luz de 47 años, solo estudio hasta 2º grado de estudio, es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería; sus hijos una estudia y el otro trabaja con el papá.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa americana cuyo negocio tiene 2 años de tenerlo, el cual lo aprendió de una amiga. Anteriormente se dedicaba a los oficios del hogar. La señora luz viaja 15 minutos en un auto bus hasta la ciudad, que es donde tiene el negocio el cual le ayuda a atenderlo su hija, después de las clases  y lo hace periódicamente desde las 6:00 a m a 3:00 p m.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  una caja de ropa, que le viene de estados unidos y rentara un local en el mercado central. Gracias al préstamo, podrá surtir su negocio y sus ingresos mejoraran para tener una vida mejor  y con las ganancias seguir mejorando su negocio.

Sueña con surtir su negocio, sacar adelante el estudio de su hija y ademas mejorar su vivienda (ampliarla).  Para todo esto, sabe que podrá lograrlo, solamente si continua trabajando fuertemente, como hasta hoy lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
Luz, 47, only studied until 2nd grade.  She is the mother of two children and her husband is a builder.  One of her children studies and the other works with his father.

She sells American clothing, a business which she has had for 2 years and which she learnt from a friend.  Before this, she dedicated her time to housework.  Now she takes the 15-minute bus ride into town, where she has her business.  Her daughter helps her after classes and on occasions from 6 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon.

She is asking for a loan to buy a box of clothing, which is coming from the U.S. and she will rent a space in the central market.  Thanks to the loan, she will be able to supply her business and her profits will improve so she can have a better life.  Her earnings will allow her to continue developing her business.

Her dreams are to stock her business, pay for her daughter’s education and also improve her house (with an extension).  She knows that she’ll only be able to fulfill her dreams if she continues to work hard, just as she has been doing up until now.

loans.use: to buy a box of clothes from the U.S. and to rent a space at the central market

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Ekua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ekua sells salted and smoked fish in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about seven years. As a widow with six children, Ekua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Ekua will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Ekua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида жизнерадостная, добрая девушка. Мастерица на все руки. Ей 32 года. Замужем. Имеет троих детей. Муж Фариды Джамшед уехал в Россию на заработки. У Фариды очень дружная и большая семья. Живут они с родителями. Семейный бюджет у них общий. Свекр Фариды тоже находиться в России, работает вместе с сыном. Сама Фарида недавно начала торговать на рынке продуктами питания. Продукты Фарида привозит с города. В свободное время она занимается откормом мелко рогатого скота. Это еще один дополнительный доход для их семьи. Фарида хотела бы реализовать свой новый бизнес. В будущем она себя видеть как успешного бизнесмена. Фарида не хочет останавливаться на достигнутом. Ей же для этой цели нужны денежные средства. Фарида пришла в "АРВАНД" за кредитом чтобы закупить продукты питания и надеется что Арванд с радостью поддержит Фариду.
texts.en: Farida is a kind and cheerful woman and a master of all trades.  She is 32 years old and she is married with three children.  Her husband Jamshed left to work in Russia.  Farida has a large and very close-knit family - they live with her parents and their family budget is shared by all.  Farida's mother-in-law is also in Russia working with her son.  Farida herself started to sell groceries at the local market not long ago.  She brings the stock in from the city.  In her spare time, she raises sheep and goats, which is one more additional source of income for her family.  Farida would like to make her new business work.  She sees herself as a successful businesswoman in the future and she doesn't want to stop the progress she has made.  To reach this goal, Farida needs money.  She has turned to "ARVAND" for a loan to buy food products and she is counting on Arvand's eager support of her.

loans.use: to buy food

loans.name: Muslihidin

texts.ru: Муслихиддин несмотря на свой ранний возраст очень трудолюбивый молодой человек и уже занимается несколькими деятельностями. Он родился в 1994 году в селе Хонобод Исфаринского района Республики Таджикистан, не женат. Имеет среднее образование. Муслихидин занимается откормом скота и одновременно является отделочникам и производит ремонт в желых помещениях. Но хороший и стабильный доход у него от откорма скота. Поэтому Муслихиддин планирует расширить свой бизнес и увеличит свой доход путем увеличения числа скотов. С этой целью он обратился в Арванд за кредитом.  Он начинающий молодой бизнесмен и имеет очень хорошие перспективы, потому что как сельский житель он любить эту деятельность. Выражает благодарность Арванд за поддержку в реализации его планов.
texts.en: Despite his young age, Muslihidin is a very hardworking young man and already has several businesses. He was born in 1994 in the village of Honobod in the Isfara District of the Republic of Tajikistan. He is unmarried. He has a secondary education. Muslihidin fattens up cattle for resale and simultaneously works as a mason and repairs residential properties. However, his good, stable earnings come from his cattle rearing business. This is why Muslihidin plans to expand his business and increase his earnings by increasing his herd. For this purpose he turned to Arvand for a loan. He is a young businessman who is just starting out and he has a really positive perspective because, as a rural dweller, he loves this kind of business. He thanks Arvand for the support in helping him realize his plans.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Las Canelas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS CANELAS”  iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margarita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de deportivos para niños, venta de verduras, venta de quinua, tienda de barrio, artesana en mantas, venta de fideo, costura de chamarras, educadora, venta de polainas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margarita es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura de chamarras; este negocio lo inicio al realizar trabajos para otra persona, con los ahorros que generó decide establecer su negocio propio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es viuda y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación en salud y crédito y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The communal bank "LAS CANELAS" will begin its eighth loan cycle through the Pro Mujer Program which is part of the Panamerican Social Center.  The group is comprised of eight members and the president of the management board is Margarita.  The businesses of the group members are varied and include sewing children's sportswear, vegetable sales, quinoa sales, convenience store, blanket weaving, noodle sales, jacket sewing, teaching and leg warmer sales.

The loan being requested will benefit small business owners including Margarita.  She says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for four years and joined by invitation from a promoter of the institution who visited her home.  She is currently running a sewing shop where she makes jackets.  She started the business by taking orders from other people.  With her savings she was able to set up her own business.

She plans to use the loan to increase her work capital and buy fabric from dealers in the city of El Alto.  Then she will produce the goods she will sell at her shop.  Her work earns her enough income to support her household.  She is a widow and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says it is the training regarding health, credit and saving.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Rosas De Ollajsantia Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE OLLAJSANTIA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, tejido de chompas y mantas, venta de comida, venta de estuco, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de estuco; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo, ya que anteriormente él trabajaba con esta actividad, posteriormente a su matrimonio deciden ampliar su capital
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de estuco) que adquirirá de las comunidades del Departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "ROSAS DE OLLAJSANTIA" is beginning its first loan cycle through the Pro Mujer Program which is run by the Social Center of Los Andes.  The group is comprised of eight members whose management board is chaired by Julia.  The members' businesses are varied and include a convenience store, sweater and blanket weaving, food sales, plaster sales and vegetable sales.

The loan being requested will benefit small business owners including Julia.  She says this is her first Pro Mujer experience and she joined by invitation from a promoter of the institution who visited her at home.  Julia is in the business of selling plaster and she learned the trade through her husband who already worked in the sector.  After they married they decided to increase their work capital.

The loan is to be used as work capital to buy plaster in communities in the department of La Paz.  Julia will later sell it on an order basis.  Her work allows her to earn enough income to support the family.  She is married and has six children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says it is the training regarding health and credit.

loans.use: To buy plaster.

loans.name: Laura Maria

texts.es: Laura María es casada y habita en Managua, tiene solamente sexto grado aprobado y desde hace 15  años está dedicada a su pequeño negocio familiar, el cual es una pulpería, este le permite obtener ingresos que cubran una parte del total de gastos en su hogar, además ella divide el tiempo en las labores domesticas de su casa, su negocio y un curso de belleza, ella quiere en un fututo tener una fuente adicional de ingreso con su propio salón. Doña Laura solicita el préstamo para seguir creciendo en su negocio de comercialización de granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, carne de pollo y diversos productos para el hogar y la familia, quienes creen que puede crecer en su negocio con el apoyo de un préstamo.
texts.en:
Laura María is married and lives in Managua.  She has a sixth grade education and has been running a small family business for 15 years.  Her grocery store allows her to earn an income to cover part of the household expenses.  She divides her time between the housework, running her business and taking a beauty course.  In the future she wants to add her own beauty salon to her business. 

Laura is requesting a loan to expand her grocery business.  She will buy rice, beans, sugar, chicken and other home products and believes the loan will help her reach her goal.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, chicken and other home products.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
La señora  Ana Cristina  de 26   años de edad es casada,  tiene dos hijos   que dependen de ella, sus hijos tienen  06 meses y 08 años, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras y tiene casa propia.
Doña Ana Cristina se dedica desde hace 06 años a su negocio que es una pulpería, su venta es en su casa y sus clientes son los amigos y personas que llegan a diario a su negocio.
Doña Ana Cristina es una mujer trabajadora y desea sacar adelante a su familia, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de arroz, azúcar, café, pan, manteca, frijoles, queso, huevos, sal, refrescos, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo desea comprar más productos y así tener mejores ganancias y de esa forma atender mejor a sus clientes.
Su sueño es hacer más grande su negocio, es su sexto préstamo que solicita a Prisma.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Ana Cristina, 26, is married and has two dependant children, ages six months and eight years.  She lives in her own house in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.

For six years Ana Cristina has been running a grocery store from her home.  Her customers are friends and people who visit daily.

Ana Cristina is a hard-working woman who wants to provide for her family.  She is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, coffee, bread, shortening, beans, cheese, eggs, salt, soft drinks, etc.  The loan will allow her to purchase more products and earn more profit, since she will be able to provide better customer service.

Her goal is to expand her business.  This is her sixth loan through Prisma.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - September, 2013.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, coffee, bread, shortening, beans, cheese, eggs, salt, soft drinks, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La señora  Gladis Marina de 60 años de edad es casada,   vive con sus  dos nietos y su madre  en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 16  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería en su negocio ubicado en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Gladis en su negocio  vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar, también vende comidas, frescos, sopas de mondongo, tortillas para baleadas y agua en bolsa, es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Gladis vende de todo y gracias a su actividad ha podido salir adelante a sus hijos, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de frescos, aguas, café, pan, maíz, azúcar, manteca, harina, huevos, 12 gallinas y dos cerdos, con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar su ingreso y salir adelante.
Doña Gladis está muy contenta de solicitar un nuevo préstamo en Prisma, su sueño es mejorar su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Gladis Marina, 60, is married and lives with her two grandchildren and her mother.  For 16 years she has been running a grocery store in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.

Gladis sells everything related to the family basket, including ready meals, fresh produce, soups, tortillas, water in a bag, etc.  She is a hard-working, enterprising woman who is determined to get ahead.

Gladis sells a bit of everything and thanks to her work she has been able to support her children.  She is requesting a loan to buy fresh produce, water, coffee, bread, corn, sugar, shortening, flour, eggs, 12 chickens and two pigs.  The loan will help improve her income so she can get ahead.

Gladis is very grateful for the new loan from Prisma.  Her goal is to improve her business.



San Lorenzo, Honduras - September, 2013.

loans.use: To buy fresh produce, water, coffee, bread, corn, sugar, shortening, flour, eggs, 12 chickens and two pigs for her business.

loans.name: Laura Del Carmen

texts.es: Laura del Carmen es casada, habita en Managua, ella es el principal y único pilar de su familia porque su esposo posee impedimentos físicos que le dificultan realizar algunas actividades, a pesar de ello, él apoya en el negocio de su esposa, el cual desarrolla desde hace más 20 años. Laura es comerciante minorista de productos de uso personal y familiar, el cual distribuye por encargo y siempre mantiene un inventario en casa para aquellos clientes eventuales, durante los últimos meses  su clientela ha ido creciendo y tiene la necesidad de invertir en la compra de cosméticos, productos de uso personal  como: crema, shampoo, perfume, desodorante entre otros y variedad de artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Laura del Carmen is married. She lives in Managua. She is the family’s main support, since her husband is handicapped and cannot perform certain activities. Nevertheless, he helps her with her business, which she has had for over twenty years.

Laura is a retailer, she sells personal-use and family products. She sells them upon request but keeps some inventory for occasional sales. In the last few months, her customer base has grown and she sees the need to invest in more cosmetics and other personal products, such as creams, shampoo, perfumes and deodorants, as well as in assorted home accessories.

loans.use: to buy personal products such as cosmetics, creams and shampoos, and home accessories.

loans.name: Helmer Porfirio

texts.es:
Helmer es un hombre de 54 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe con su familia, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que  dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Helmer no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Helmer trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de alfalfa, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Helmer se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizará el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea reforzar el techado y ponerle piso a su hogar, así pues brindara mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Helmer is a 54-year-old man who lives with his family in the city of Chiclayo, Guadalupe district. He is a hardworking and enthusiastic man, fighting to get ahead with his family. Unfortunately, due to the lack of resources and the need to work, he could not study to become a professional.

Helmer opened a small business selling alfalfa. He works every day for approximately ten hours and believes that he does well because of his hard work and dedication.

Helmer feels grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help, he will make some home improvements. He needs to reinforce the roof and install the floor, which will result in safety and well-being for his family.

loans.use: to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрату 33 года. Он женат, является отцом 5-летнего сына и 2-летней дочери. У Шухрата есть цех по переработке и измельчению пшеницы для изготовления муки. Он начал свой бизнес 10 лет назад в своем районе Хамадони. В Хамадони многие жители занимаются земледелием, в том числе сеят пшеницу. Поставщиком сырья для Шухрата являются сами жители. Как бизнесмену Шухрату очень повезло, ему не приходится далеко идти или заказывать сырьё из другой области. Шухрату в бизнесе помогает его брат. До сегодняшнего дня они работали в ручную. Теперь Шухрат просит кредит, чтобы приобрести  специальное оборудование для измельчения муки. Он хочет заказать мукомольное оборудование из города Душанбе. Такая техника стоит очень дорого и поэтому из-за нехватки финансов он обратился за кредитом. Благодаря данному оборудованию работа цеха ускорится намного раз, качество продукции (муки) улучшится и их цех будет процветать.
texts.en: Shuhrat is 33 years old. He is married and is the father to a five-year-old son and a two-year-old daughter. Shahrat has a workshop for processing and grinding wheat to make flour. He started his business 10 years ago in his district of Hamadoni. In Hamadoni, many residents practice agriculture, including sowing wheat. The residents themselves are Shuhrat's raw material suppliers. Shuhrat has been very lucky as a businessman, as he does not have to go far for his raw materials or order them from another district. Shahrut's brother helps him with his business. Until now, they have been doing the processing by hand. Now Shuhrat is requesting a loan to purchase a special machine for flour grinding. He wants to order the milling machinery from the city of Dushanbe. This kind of equipment is very expensive, which is why he did not have enough money for it and requested a loan. Thanks to this machinery, work at the workshop will go much faster, the quality of the product (flour) will get better and their work shop will prosper.

loans.use: to buy milling machinery.

loans.name: David Felix

texts.es:
David tiene 37 años de edad, trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de helados y con los ingresos de su humilde negocio saca adelante a su familia, la cual está conformada por su esposa y sus 5 hijos; David cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y atiende a sus clientes de manera amable.

David esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a este apoyo David podrá comprar un terreno para poder construir un pequeño local para su negocio, de esta manera poder crecer y hacer realidad s gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
David is 37 years old. He works in his small ice cream selling business. With the income from his humble business he gets his family ahead. He has a wife and 5 children. David thinks his business is going well for him because he is very responsible and serves in customers in a very friendly way.  

David is grateful to the Kive lenders because thanks to their help David will be able to build a small locale for his business. This way, he can grow and make his big dream come true: "giving his children a profession."

loans.use: to buy some land.

loans.name: Rahmat

texts.ru: Рахмату 54 года. Он женат на Манзуре и живет с женой, невесткой и внуком в городе Худжанд. Рахмат в течение 20 лет проработал инженером в горсвете. Параллельно он еще и занимался птицеводством. Теперь Рахмат хочет воплотить свою давнюю мечту. Он планирует идти по стопам своего деда и заняться производством веревок. В данный момент он нигде не работает и все его внимание и усилия переключены на открытия данного прибыльного бизнеса. На деньги от кредита он собирается купить оборудование для производства веревок. Работать в этой сфере, ему поможет опыт, который оставил ему дед. У Рахмата накопилось сбережений от птицеводства, и он хочет потратить эту сумму вместе с кредитом на покупку оборудования, потому что оно стоит очень дорого. Рахмат настроен решительно заняться этим делом. Он уже приобрел помещение для цеха и планирует нанять двух рабочих. Для него Ваша помощь очень необходима! Он ждет Вашу отзывчивость!
texts.en: Rahmat is 54 years old. He is married to Manzura and lives with his wife, daughter in law and grandson in the city of Khujand. Rahmat has spent 20 years working as an engineer for the city council. At the same time he also bred poultry. Now Rahmat wants to fulfil his long-held dream. He plans to follow in the footsteps of his grandfather and work producing ropes. At the moment he is not working and is concentrating all his attention and strength on opening a profitable business in the trade just mentioned. With the money from a loan he plans to buy equipment to produce ropes. He will be helped in work in this field by experience gained from his grandfather. Rahmat has accumulated savings from poultry farming and he wants to spend this money, together with the loan, on the purchase of equipment because it is very expensive. Rahmat is absolutely determined to make this business work. He has already bought premises for a workshop and plans to hire two employees. Your help is absolutely essential for him! He awaits your generosity!

loans.use: to buy equipment to open a rope-making workshop

loans.name: Clayris

texts.es:
La señora Clayris es una persona honesta y  trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 5 años.
Doña Clayris es muy conocida y visitada por los vecinos de su comunidad. Está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, manteca, huevos, queso, refrescos, churros, arroz, frijoles, pan, café, mantequilla, carne, jugos, entre otras que necesita para surtir más de producto su negocio.
Doña Clayris espera que el préstamo le ayude mucho ya que no cuenta con los insumos necesarios, además desea un aumento en las ventas y con esto ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar. Ella espera aumentar su negocio y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2013
texts.en:
Clayris is an honest and hardworking person. She lives in a community in southern Honduras with her husband and their 2 children. Her business has been a convenience store for 5 years.

Clayris is very well known and visited by the residents of her community. She is asking for the loan to buy corn, lard, eggs, cheese, beverages, churros, rice, beans, bread, coffee, butter, meat, juices, and more that she needs to stock more products in her business. 

Clayris hopes that the loan will help her a lot since she doesn't have a lot of necessary items. In addition to earning more income, she wants to benefit her family's quality of life at home. She hopes to grow her business and keep supporting her children in their studies so that they can have better opportunities in life. 



Choluteca, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, lard, eggs, beverages, churros, rice, beans, bread, coffee, butter, meat and  juice for her business.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар жизнерадостная и ответственная женщина. Она замужем и имеет одного ребёнка. Но со своей семьёй Дилбар живёт в родительском доме, вместе со своими родителями, так как они пенсионеры и нуждаются в заботе. Чтобы зарабатывать на проживание Дилбар занимается купли продажей золотых изделий. Для ведения этого бизнеса она имеет специальную торговую точку. Также Дилбар имеет собственную столовую, где приготавливают плов и шашлык, от этого бизнеса у неё также есть стабильный дополнительный доход. Так как Дилбар закупает золотые изделия в другом городе, который находится далеко, она хочет приобрести собственную машину для перевозки своего товара, чтобы облегчить и более обезопасить процесс перевозки. Для этого Дилбар обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку машины. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Dilbar is a happy and responsible woman. She is married and has one child. Dilbar lives with her family and her parents in their home because they are elderly and need support. Dilbar buys and sells gold goods to make a living. She has a special vendor location where she runs her business. Dilbar also has her own eatery where plov (pilau rice and meat) and shish kabob is made and has a stable additional income from this business as well. Because Dilbar buys gold goods in another town which is located far away she wants to buy her own car to bring merchandise and make the transportation process easier and more safe. She has come to Arvand for this reason and wants to get a loan to buy a car. Dilbar hopes for a positive outcome and is thanking Arvand for support in advance.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Jose Omar

texts.es: José Omar es un señor de 49 años de edad, habita en Mangua y ha procreado dos hijas con su esposa, él actualmente trabaja durante las horas de la noche en un restaurante y por el día apoya a su esposa en el manejo del hogar y la familia, él está consciente que una de sus dos hijas de 10 años de edad aun se encuentra en etapa escolar, requiriendo esto mucho esfuerzo de su parte. Don José solicita el crédito para realizar un pequeño anexo en la parte frontal de su actual vivienda, considerando que la existente es insegura y no presta las óptimas condiciones para habitarla, para tal actividad necesita realizara la compra de materiales de construcción como: bloques, acero, cemento, arena, hierro, piedras canteras y el pago de  mano de obra.
texts.en: José Omar is a 49 year old man. He lives in Managua  and has two daughters with his wife. Right now he works nights at a restaurant and during the day he helps his wife manage the home and the family. He is aware that one of his two daughters is ten and still school aged and this requires a lot of work from him. José is asking for the loan to build a small addition on the front part of the his house. He thinks it is unsafe now and that it does not have optimal living conditions. For this e needs to buy construction materials such as blocks, steel, cement, sand, iron and quarry stone, as well as to pay for the labor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as blocks, steel, cent, sand, iron, and quarry stone, as well as pay for labor.

loans.name: Sabira

texts.ru: Сабире 56 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Сабиры - высшее образование, работает преподавателем в местной школе. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Сабира занимается животноводством сразу же после распада союза, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сабиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 1 теленок, 1 нетель, 28 овец, также имеет земельный надел, мерою 2,40 ГА, на котором ежегодно выращивает фасоль, картофель и многолетние травы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сабира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Сабира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Sabira is 56 years old, she is married and is raising two children with her husband. Sabira has higher education and works as a teacher in school. As an additional income for her family Sabira's family started animal husbandry with a purchase of livestock for 10,000 KGS right after the collapse of the Soviet Union. Because of her hard work Sabira now has one milk cow, one horse, one calf, one heifer and 28 sheep as well as a plot of land in the size of 2.40 hectares where she annually grows beans, potato and perennial grasses. Her monthly income is 13,000 som (KGS). With the goal to further grow her business Sabira has come to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 80,000 KGS to buy calves to increase the headcount of livestock. Sabira plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of livestock and also save money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Johanna Milady

texts.es: Johanna de 23 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto a su madre desde hace mucho tiempo. Su principal fuente de ingresos es por medio de una mini tienda y pupuseria (preparación alimenticia a base de masa de maíz, frijoles y queso). Es una joven muy trabajadora, emprendedora y responsable. Con el fin de darle mayor seguridad a su vivienda  desea  construir un muro perimetral de ladrillo y cemento ya que el que posee es de lámina y se encuentra en mal estado. Solicita un crédito a FUSAI para hacer la inversión en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro. De esta forma espera poder contar con mejores condiciones para ella y su madre.
texts.en: Johanna, who is 23, has lived for some time in her own home along with her mother.  Her main source of income is a small shop-cum-pupeseria (selling a type of corn tortilla with beans and cheese).  She is a very hardworking, enterprising and responsible young woman.  As she would like to make her home more secure, she wants to build an outside wall of brick and cement since the current wall is made of corrugated metal and is in a bad condition.  She is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in the purchase of bricks, cement, sand and iron.  She hopes that this will enable her to provide better conditions for herself and her mother.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron to build an outside wall for greater security.

loans.name: Iago

texts.en:
Iago is a 36-year-old married man with two children living in the town of Rustavi, near the capital city. His wife works as a hair stylist at the beauty salon and Iago is an operator at the petrol station. The couple gets monthly salaries and their income is $270.  

As the existing income is not big enough for the four-member family, Iago decided to earn additional income and purchase a second-hand car to use as a taxi. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Iago applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses.  A loan of $1300  will help Iago to start a taxi business. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them inter-city.  Iago is a very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to provide his children with a good education for progress in life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. Iago is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a car to use as a taxi

loans.name: Tabernaculo De David Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socios emprendedores uno de ellos es Elda mujer de 27 años, acompañada, con dos hijos menores, su negocio es la venta de enchiladas, frescos, platanitos y hamacas desde hace 2 años, el crédito lo está solicitando para mejoras para la casa y compra de materia prima como canasto de plátanos, aceite, leña y hamacas . Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año. Rosa mujer de 38 años su negocio es la venta de nacatamales y Angel hombre de 38 años su negocio es un taller de calzado.
texts.en: The group is made up of three enterprising members, one of whom is Elda, a woman of 27, who is married with two young children.  She has worked selling enchiladas, fresh fruit, plantain chips and hammocks for 2 years.  She is seeking the loan to make improvements to her home and to buy raw materials such as banana baskets, oils, wood and hammocks. She will soon have been a client of the institution for 1 year.  Rosa, who is 38, works selling tamales and Angel, who is a man of 38, makes footwear.

loans.use: to make improvements to their home and to buy raw materials such as banana baskets, oils, wood and hammocks.

loans.name: Aguas Verdes Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socias trabajadoras una de ellas es Odily  tiene la edad  de 27 años, acompañada, con un hijo menor de edad, su negocio es la venta de pinolillo, pinol, tamales  desde hace 4 años, el  crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los productos como quintal de maíz, leña, cacao, clavo de olor, canela, queso, dulce, etc. Paula tiene la edad de 46 años su negocio es una mini pulpería desde hace 3 años además, vende comida como tacos, enchilada, vigoron, Juana tiene 30 años su negocio es la venta de frutas desde hace 17 años.
texts.en: The group is made up of three hardworking members, one of whom is Odily, who is 27 and married with a young child.  She has been selling pinolillo ( a cornmeal and cocoa drink) and tamales for 4 years.  She is applying for the loan to buy raw materials to make goods such as 100lbs of corn, wood, cocoa, cloves, cinnamon, cheese, sweetmeats, etc.  Paula, who is 46, has run a small grocery shop for 3 years and additionally sells tacos, enchiladas and vigorón (cabbage salad).  Juana, who is 30, has been selling fruit for 17 years.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials necessary for the production of goods: 100lbs of corn, wood, cocoa, cloves, cinnamon, cheese, sweetmeats, etc.

loans.name: Almendrito Group

texts.es: Grupo Formado por cuatro socias luchadoras una de ellas es Patricia mujer de 30 años de edad, casada, con un hijo menor, su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio  y venta de frutas y verduras  desde hace 15 años, tiene de ser cliente de la institución 4 años. El crédito lo solicita  para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón de lavar ropa, papel higiénico, café, gaseosas, etc. Argentina mujer de 31 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos  por catálogo de Avon, Maritza mujer de 48 años su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y una mini pulpería  y Jenny mujer de 33 años su negocio es venta de verduras.
texts.en: The group is made up of 4 determined members, one of whom is 30-year-old Patricia, who is married with a young child.  She runs a grocery shop from her home and has been selling fruit and vegetables for 15 years.  She will soon have been a client of the institution for 4 years.  She is applying for the loan to buy basic grains such as rice and sugar, oil, washing powder, toilet paper, coffee, soft drinks, etc.  Argentina is a woman of 31 who sells Avon cosmetics, Maritza is a woman of 48 who sells new clothing and runs a small grocery shop and Jenny is a woman of 33 who sells vegetables.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice and sugar, oil, washing powder, toilet paper, coffee, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Comfort's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of four members, all women and all responsible for their families. They come from Teshie which is located in the coastal zone of the country. These people are characterized by being hard working, responsible, and wanting to excel. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, they were not able to study and were obligated to work from a young age in order to help with the household expenses.

Comfort has been selling wax-print fabric for twenty-four years. She does this work 8 hours daily on foot. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with different fabric of wax-prints so that in the not too distant future, she can obtain better income. 
ID Ghana is appreciative of the support of Kiva investors.

They will need a total loan of GHS 5,200 to buy enough stock to sell and make enough profit.

loans.use: to purchase different wax-print fabric so that in the not too distant future, she can obtain better income.

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhorn, 46, is single and residing in a rural village of the Sangke district of the Battambang province. To make a living, she has been farming rice and making Khmer Noodles to sell. Skhorn is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day and she can manage to save about 23,000 KHR each day each day after daily expenses. 
Sokhorn’s group consists of two members who are both female and have both been with VisionFund for one cycle. Sokhorn completely paid back her previous loan with VisionFund and successfully used the loan to better support her family. She and her group member are applying for a new loan. As the leader, Sokhorn is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on making Khmer Noodles. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Abena is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling charcoal in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. Abena is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Abena wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, thus allowing her to sell greater quantities of charcoal. In the long term, Abena plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thereby helping her expand to meet the demands of rising customer needs.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil and bags of rice.

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas Flor mujer de 24 años de edad, soltera, su negocio es la venta de derivados del maíz como la chicha, pinol, pinolillo desde hace 10 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de  inventario como maíz por quintal, leña, cacao, rodamina, bolsas, vainilla, frambuesa. Ana mujer de 56 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de verduras, perecederos y María  mujer de 39 años de edad su negocio es la venta de derivados del maíz como pinol y pinolillo.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three enterprising members. Flor is one of them. She is 24 years old, single, and has had a business selling maize-based products such as chicha, pinol and pinolillo, which are regional beverages, for 10 years. She has been a client of the institution for one year. She is requesting a loan to buy stock such as quintales of maize, firewood, cocoa, rhodamine, bags, vanilla and raspberries. 

Ana is 56 ayears old, and has a business selling vegetables and perishable food items, and Maria is 39 years old and has a business selling maize-based products such as pinol and pinolillo.

loans.use: to buy stock such as quintales of maize, firewood, cocoa, rhodamine, bags, vanilla and raspberries.

loans.name: Anasthase

texts.en:
Anasthase is 41 years old. He has six children aged between three months and 18 years. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena is divorced and has three children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Helena is a successful businesswoman. She sells smoked fish in Apewosika, near Cape Coast.
