She is asking for a loan to purchase cloth materials, sewing threads for her business that will help her to invest back into her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, sewing threads for her business

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is from Kapan town where he lives with his wife and two little children. He has been involved in the taxi driving business for 3 years. Arman's wife is working at a local shop as a florist designer and helps her husband with the family's costs. However, the main income of the family comes from Arman's taxi driving business, so he works very hard to gathering good income for his family. Now, to be able to renovate his car and purchase new tires for winter season, Arman needs financial support. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 
So, the loan will be a great support for Arman and he will be very grateful to all the lenders.

loans.use: to pay for new tires and car repair

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
Medius is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is single and has 2 children. For the past 5 years, Medius has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap and salt. 

To help expand her business, Medius has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential items such as sugar, milk and bread for sale, and will help Medius to generate greater profits and increse more in the business and take care of her children. Medius hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her stocks and will also be able to borrow more money from Brac. 

Medius is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Medius who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential items such as sugar, milk and bread for sell,

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Even though Esi grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Esi is an entrepreneur. She sells corn dough in Efutu Manpong (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began five years ago. Esi is married and has seven children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Esi wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of corn dough. In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of corn dough.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Aba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling charcoal in Efutu Manpong (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for thirteen years. Aba is married and has four children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Aba wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of charcoal. In the long term, Aba plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of charcoal.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Aba did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Aba sells minerals for water in Efutu Manpong (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about two years. As a divorcee with five children, Aba uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Aba will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of minerals, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Aba wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of minerals, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Sylvestre

texts.en:
Sylvestre is 41 years old. He is a father of six children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase the plants' production of maize. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he will be able to acquire machines and tractors that would enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel aged 37. He is married with five children. He has requested a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
This is Beatrice, aged 44. She is a widow and is taking care of three children. She would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer, in order to increase the plants' production of maize. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business, so that in the future she will be able to acquire machines and tractors that would enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia  is married and has seven children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids.

For the past four years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers are her potential customers.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat for sale. She dreams of expanding to a modern shop for the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat for sale

loans.name: Servete

texts.en: Servete is 43, married and the mother of 4 children between the ages of 17 and 25 years old. Her husband works in a bakery and she has operated a handicraft business from her home for more than 10 years now. In addition to her handicrafts, she makes traditional clothing and has 5 women employed to help her. She is a very hard worker and has a lot of clients and customers. Sevete is requesting a loan through KosInvest in order to purchase thread, needles and other materials for her work. She hopes to earn a higher income and to expand her business even more. She is happy for the financial support from the lenders because it helps her to secure a stable future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase thread, needles and other materials for handicraft work

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member (her father). She has a business selling used children's clothing to all categories of people but on a retail basis only. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of children’s clothes. She has been in this clothing business for five years and sells six days out of every week.  Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality.  She aspires to become an importer of used clothes and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 41 years old from Dagohoy, Bohol. She is married with two children ages 18 and 20. Marilyn has owned a Sari-sari store that caters to the needs of her neighborhood for nine years now. She sells basic household items like seasoning, canned goods, noodles, eggs, toiletries, snack food, candies and soft drinks. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of canned sardines, corned beef, cooking oil, shampoo, soft drinks and different vegetables. She is hoping that with the loan she will not experience a lack of items needed by her customers. Her income will be for family daily consumption. 

In the future, she hopes to have an abundant life and more capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her general store

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is widow and has three children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Aba is a successful businesswoman. She sells charcoal in Efutu Manpong (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about two years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Aba uses her income to provide for the entire family. Aba will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of charcoal, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of charcoal, to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 45 years old from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with 3 children ages 10, 13 and 15. To provide for her family, she has a farming business. She has been farming rice for three years now, earning 2000 PHP per month. She is struggling to keep her farming business and so she sought a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. Her main goal is to have a higher income out of this business so she can reinvest her profit on other business opportunities. The additional income will go to her family's daily consumption and her children's education.

In the future, Marites hopes to successfully send her children to college until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Saboat

texts.ru: Сабоат сильная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1967 года на северной части горного Таджикистана. Сабоат в 2009 года пережила глубокий стресс. Ее любимый муж умер. После смерти мужа все хлопоты остались одной ей. Она воспитывает 4 детей. Сабоат взяла себя в руки и продолжала дальше жить. Она работает в городской больнице медсестрой. Сабоат честная женщина и имеет хорошую репутацию среди сотрудников. Сабоат недавно выдала замуж дочь и женила младшего сына. Теперь она должна отремонтировать свой старый дом, который достался ей от мужа. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как краски, цемент и т.п. для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Saboat is a strong and hardworking woman.  She was born in 1967 in the northern part of mountainous Tajikistan.  In 2009, Saboat went through severe stress when her beloved husband passed away.  After his death, all of her troubles became one.  She is raising 4 children, so Saboat pulled herself together and carried on living.  She works in the city hospital as a nurse.  Saboat is an honest woman and has a good reputation among her co-workers.  Saboat recently married off her daughter and her younger son.  She needs to repair her old house, which was left to her by her husband.  She is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS in order to purchase building materials like paint, cement, etc., for the repair of her home.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials like paint and cement in order to repair her house

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is 41 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have four children. He would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en:
Anastase is 43 years old. He has requested a Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizers during his maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs

loans.name: Gelas

texts.en:
Gelas is a 50-year-old widow. She faced a hard time supporting her son, without proper education or a steady job. She started her own business in 2010 and bought an old sewing machine.

When she heard about Izdiharona's 'qard hassan,' she took a loan to change her old sewing machine and buy fabric, which will improve the quality of her work. ('Qard hassan' is a loan product for widowed women, without interest, that helps them to increase their incomes.) Gelas is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits, and she wants to be able to train other women in her neighborhood.

The story of Gelas and her sewing business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development clients.

loans.use: to buy a better sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua grew up in poverty and without an education, but this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently, Efua is an entrepreneur. She sells slippers (flip-flops) in Efutu Manpong, near Cape Coast. Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began five years ago.

Efua is married and has three children. Her husband works as a photographer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband to cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees.

Efua wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory level, which will allow her to sell a greater quantity of slippers. In the long term, Efua plans to reinvest future profits into her business. This will help her to expand and to meet the rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory level, which will allow her to sell a greater quantity of slippers (flip-flops)

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is single and has four children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Esi is a successful businesswoman. She sells sells 'kokonte,' a Ghanaian food staple, in Efutu Manpong (near Cape Coast).  She has been actively involved in this business for about a year. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Esi uses her income to provide for the entire family.

Esi will use the loan to purchase a larger amount of 'kokonte,' which will enable her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, thus adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase a larger amount of 'kokonte' to sell

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
58-year-old Martina has been raising hogs for ten years now. She lives in San Miguel, Bohol with her husband. Together, they have four grown children. This livelihood helps in bringing in an income of PHP 3,000 per month for their needs. 

Martina is asking for a loan to buy hog mash, grower, and supplements. She plans to continue investing in hog-raising and to make the business even bigger, to uplift their living conditions. 

In the future, Martina hopes to expand her business and have a bigger piggery, for increased profits.

loans.use: to buy hog mash, grower, and supplements.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married mother with five children, three of whom attend school and two are still young. They live at their own house that has electricity but not piped water. 

She has operated a shop business, selling goods at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other shop operators in her business. 

With Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for resale. She dreams of expanding to her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for resale.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is 49 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Deo has been working hard to manage his stationary shop, which sells stationary items such as books. 

To help expand his business, Deo has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more staionary items such as exercise books and pens to sell, and will help Deo to generate greater profits and improve on the economic status of his family. Deo hopes that in the future he will be able to own a bigger stationary shop. 

Deo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Deo who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more staionary items such as exercise books and pens to sell

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 37 years old. He is married and blessed with four children. He would like to use his Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizers to use during his maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Despite having grown up in poverty and without a formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She sells minerals in Efutu Manpong (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for one year. Esi is married, and her husband works as a teacher. The proceeds from her business help her husband to support their six children.

Esi has identified that there is growing demand among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more minerals to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi wants to buck the trend, by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more minerals to sell.

loans.name: Hamazasp

texts.en:
Hamazasp is from Gyumri town. He is the priest of the St. Jacob Church where he performs wedding and funeral rites.  In the basement of the church, Hamazasp is also providing lessons in foreign languages, computers and art for children for free. Due to his kind attitude toward children, he has a large number of students who come to the church with great love and pleasure. Hamazasp is also a beloved father of three children.
 
To purchase chairs, a table, and two computers, Hamazasp needs financial support. As the place where he teaches does not have sufficient conditions for children, he wants to improve it. 

Hamazasp has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So the loan will greatly assist Hamazasp to continue his social mission.

loans.use: to pay for chairs, a table and two computers

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a widowed woman with five kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Oliyakhon

texts.ru: Олияхон жизнерадостная и начитанная женщина. Она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Олияхон имеет высшее образование. Она работает в Медицинском колледже преподавателем. Олияхон является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее муж пенсионер и получает маленькую пенсию. Она старается зарабатывать больше денег и таким образом улучшить условию проживания. Олияхон собирается открыть новый бизнес. Она хочет открыть столовую. Ее муж будет помогать ей введению бизнеса. Олияхон будет готовить национальные блюда, и продавать местным жителям. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки необходимого средства как продукты питания, чтобы открыть столовую. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Oliyakhon is a cheerful and well-read woman.  She is married and has two children.  Oliyakhon has a higher education and works as a teacher at a medical college.  Oliyakhon is the main breadwinner of her family as her husband is retired and receives only a small pension.  She is trying to earn more money so that she can improve her living conditions.  She wants to open her own cafe, which her husband will help her to run.  Oliyakhon will prepare national dishes and sell them to local people.  She is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS in order to purchase necessary materials like, food products, in order to open her cafe.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy food items in order to open a cafe

loans.name: Justice's Group

texts.en:
This group was inaugurated on June 19, 2010. It is composed of five members who run revenue-generating businesses with the goal of increasing their financial capacity. The members have all been living in the same neighborhood. Their main work involves small-scale commerce and service (combs, hairbrushes, fish, footwear, and barbering). 

Justice (the male in the group) is the featured borrower of the group. He is 40 years old, married, and the father of three children (one girl and two boys). 

Justice has 11 years' experience in the hair-cutting (barbering) business. He needs a loan amount of GHS 500 to buy a barbering machine so that he can serve customers better. He could make a profit of GHS 300 per week, which would mean a quick turnover and repaying without trouble. 

The profits from his business will be used to cover family-related expenses and saving the rest with ID-Ghana. 

The group needs a total amount of GHS 2,650 to buy enough goods to sell to customers.

loans.use: To buy a barbering machine so he can serve customers better.

loans.name: Severa

texts.en:
Severa hails from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 47 years old and married, with four children, ages 7-15. 

As her husband is into farming, Sevara is into catching crabs for a living. Her business started 15 years ago and gives her an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. She is asking for a loan to buy more crab traps that will help her to become more productive. 

With a good catch, she can be assured of better income and good profits for her children's schooling. She will be able to provide nutritious food for her family too. 

In the future, she plans another business expansion and successfully sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy crab traps

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 58 years old. She is married, with five children, ages 12-29. Zosima lives in San Miguel, Bohol. 

For three years now, she is into buying and selling empty sacks, which she repairs and then sells again to buyers. These empty sacks are from rice and feed packing. This business provides her a monthly income of PHP 3,000. This greatly helps in the basic needs of her family, like food and school fees. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more sacks to repair and sell, to contribute to better profitability.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and make it even more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more empty sacks to repair and resell

loans.name: Koriya

texts.ru: Кория родилась в 1962 года. Она трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Кория вдова и имеет 2 детей. Ее сыну 33 года, а дочери 25 лет. Кория занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она занимается этим бизнесом уже много лет и имеет большой опыт. Кория является основной кормилицей семьи. Ее сын помогает ей содержать семью. Ее сын учится в университете. Кория и ее сын не имеют достаточно денег, для того чтобы оплатить за учебный договор в университете. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 14000 сомони для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Koriya was born in 1962.  She is a hardworking and kind woman.  Koriya is a widow and has two children.  Her son is 33 years old and her daughter is 25.  Koriya works as a seamstress of women's clothing.  She has been working in this business for many years and is very experienced.  Koriya is the breadwinner of her family.  Her son helps her to take care of her family and studies at the university.  Koriya and her son do not have enough money to pay for his tuition at the university.  She is asking for a loan of 14000 TJS to pay for his education.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay for her son's education

loans.name: Sheena

texts.en:
Sheena was always passionate for her grandmother’s Southern-style cooking that she enjoyed growing up in Alabama. In 2012, she and her husband, Chris, channeled that passion into starting Southern Belle’s Smokehouse, located in Bloomfield, New Jersey.

Sheena and Chris are proud to cater to their tightknit community. They are forming partnerships with local universities, so that they can offer their students the genuine, southern, home-cooked dining experience that is hard to find in New Jersey. 

Love, care and her grandmother’s inspiration go into every one of Sheena’s recipes. Her goal is to open new locations throughout the country, but for now, she plans to use her loan to purchase food inventory to set up her breakfast menu, so that she can break into a new target market.

loans.use: To purchase food inventory to expand Southern-style restaurant's breakfast menu

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is an acclaimed performer, composer and bandleader of EuroLatinFunk and EuroLatinJazz. Born into a family of singers in Madrid, Spain, Rebeca was immediately immersed in the rich musical language of flamenco. She began her public performances at the age of four, travelling through Spain and Britain, where she developed a passion for jazz.

Arriving in New York in 2000, Rebeca began collaborating and performing with the most sought-after musician of the Latin-Jazz scene. Through this exposure, she uncovered the emotional beauty and rhythmic complexity of Brazilian music. It was there that she discovered the third corner of a musical triangle that she would infuse into her own foundation.

After Hurricane Sandy hit, several of Rebeca’s clients had to cancel scheduled performances, which hurt her band’s earnings. Rebeca will use this loan to pay for merchandising, advertising and travel expenses for her upcoming tour.

loans.use: To help finance the EuroLatin musicians' upcoming tour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Marleny Elizabeth

texts.es:
Merleny, es una madre soltera, vive con sus hijos de 16, 15 y 14 años. Debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos en su hogar hace un año y medio que estableció un negocio de pupuseria y venta de tortillas y tamales, oficio que aprendió de una amiga, a pesar de atenderlo sola no ha tenido ninguna dificultad. 
Solicita capital para invertir en la compra de maíz, gas, aderezos y verduras (para la preparación de las pupusas).De esta forma brindara una mejor atención a sus clientes, ampliara su negocio y sus ganancias serán mayores, con las que ira cancelando la cuotas del préstamo.
Ella lucha por sacar adelante a sus hijos y ampliar más su negocio, su sueño es brindarle una mejor condición de vida a su familia y darles las herramientas necesarias para que alcancen una superación académica superior.
texts.en:
Merleny’s a single mother living with her children who are 16, 15 and 14 years old.  Because she needed to generate household income, she opened a pupusa [filled, grilled corn cakes], tamale, and tortilla shop a year and a half ago.  She learned this occupation from a friend and despite tending to it alone she’s had no difficulties.

She’s requesting capital to buy corn, gas, condiments and vegetables (to make the pupusas).  In this way she’ll provide better customer service, expand the business and profits that she’ll use to make the loan payments will be higher.

She strives to move her children forward and expand her business more.  Her dream is to provide her family with better quality of life and to give them the necessary tools to reach higher academic levels.

loans.use: to buy corn, gas, condiments and vegetables.

loans.name: Byron Jose

texts.es:
El sr. Byron , casado, con hijos bajo su responsabilidad, originario de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Él se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de ingeniería en sistema. Por lo tanto lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas  de salir adelante Byron tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, aceite, jugos, jabón. El dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestible para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejore ingresos. Byron agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Byron is married with children, and is from León, located in the west of the country. He is known as being hard-working and responsible, with the desire to improve himself. Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources, he was unable to go to university, however, he would have liked to study system engineering. As a result, he fights every day to give his children a better future.

Thanks to his effort and his desire to succeed, Byron works in a grocery store. It is a small shop which sells small quantities of foodstuffs such as rice, milk, bread, detergent, oil, juice and soap. He spends around twelve hours in his store every day, and enjoys it very much. 

The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock his business buying and selling foodstuffs so that in the near future, he can earn more. Byron is grateful for the help that Kiva investors give to those with limited means and poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock his store buying and selling foodstuffs such as rice, beans, milk, bread, eggs, detergents, soap and oil.

loans.name: Munkhragchaa

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhragchaa, 31 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2007. His wife has a position of technologist at a bread-selling company; currently she has taken her maternity leave. 

He is requesting a loan of MNT 2,000,000 to buy blocks to fence his land. After fencing his land, he can grow vegetables and raise livestock. 

Munkhragchaa is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to fence his land

loans.name: Nelson Antonio

texts.es: Nelson Antonio de  32  años de edad, soltero padre de dos hijos menores de edad de edad. El originario de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del  país. Nelson se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, responsables con ganas de superación personal. La actividad en la que se desempeña Nelson es la venta de artesanías, La cual consiste en viaja al país vecino de Costa Rica y ofrece la artesanía elaborada en  la localidad como ollas de barro, al cancillas, pulseras, jugos de cocina de barro, jarrones, floreros. El negocio lo aprendió de sus padres que por tradición ha sido un negocio familiar. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra y venta de artesanía para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Nelson agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo dingo.
texts.en:
Nelson Antonio, 32, is a single father of two minors.  He’s from Malpaisillo, a place located in the country’s northern zone.  Nelson’s noted for being a hardworking, responsible man with a strong self-improvement drive.

Nelson’s activity is selling traditional crafts from his area like clay pots, piggy banks, bracelets, clay kitchen ware, urns, vases, etc. in neighboring Costa Rica.  He learned the business from his parents for the business is a family tradition.

He needs financing to invest in working capital for the crafts buying and selling business so that in the not too distant future income will rise.  Nelson is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide to people of low income in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have ways to earn a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Maria Cirila

texts.es: Maria de 36 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella posee un negocio en su lugar de residencia de venta de agua, refrescos y gaseosas desde hace 6 años, posee mucha clientela pues no tiene mucha competencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, María está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así obtener mejores ganancias y poderle dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 36, is a single mother who lives in her own house with her three children. She has had a business in her place of residence selling water, sweet drinks and sodas for six years. She has many customers and she doesn't have much competition. With what she earns from her sales she is able to pay for some of the expenses of her home.

Maria is applying for a loan to buy more merchandise in bulk to continue with her business. This is her only source of work and in this way, she will obtain more revenue and be able to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy water, sweet drinks and sodas in bulk.

loans.name: Och-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr. Och-Erdene, who is 31 years old, lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods between cities since 2005 and accumulated a vast amount of experience. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home, taking care of domestic work. 

The house his family lives in has deteriorated, so he is requesting a loan of MNT 3,500,000 to buy building materials, such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam, in order to renovate his old house. 

After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and thus less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: María Lidiette

texts.es: Doña Lidiette es una mujer madre de familia, ella es la única fuente de ingresos para su familia, actualmente ha tenido problemas con las lluvias en su vivienda. ella necesita de un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para comprar los materiales y pagar la mano de obra para arreglar la vivienda donde vive con su familia. con esto ella va a poder tener una vivienda digna y darle la calidad de vida a su familia
texts.en: Lidiette's the head of her household and the only source of income for her family.  Currently she has had some problems with the rain in her house.  She needs a loan for 1,000,000 colones [CRC] to buy the materials and to pay for labor to fix the house where she lives with her family.  This way she'll have a decent home and quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials to fix her house

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan de 36 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene 3 hijos, 2 de un mes de edad y uno de 5 años de edad este ultimo estudiando. Juan estudio hasta 5° grado, su esposa es comerciante y de él dependen las cuatro personas con las que convive en la casa.

Juan tiene 17 años de trabajar como agricultor, siembra hortalizas, aprendio trabajando con su padre, decidio trabajar de esta manera porque se dio cuenta que le daba mejores ingresos que su trabajo anterior, pues se trabajaba con el transporte público.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar fertilizantes foliares y para pagar mano de obra para preparar la tierra.

Espera que con su trabajo le pueda dar el studio a sus hijos y tener lo necesario para sus hijas gemelas recien nacidas.
texts.en:
Juan is 36 years old and is married with 3 children; two are one month old and the other is 5 and is in school. Juan has a 5th grade education. His wife is a shopkeeper, but all four people live at home and depend on Juan. He has worked in agriculture for 17 years planting vegetables and learned by working with his father. He decided to do this kind of work because he noticed that it provided a better income than what he was doing before - working in public transport. 

The loan will be used to buy fertilizers that are absorbed through the leaves and to pay laborers to prepare the land. He hopes that his work will allow him to educate his children and to have the necessities for his newborn twin daughters.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Al-Tofiq Group

texts.en:
Al-Tofiq Group consists of four women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Dhakra, who lives with her children in a poor area of the city, assists her husband in generating income so as to better provide for her children. She is in the business of selling perfumes, incense, and cloth.

Dhakra would like to expand her business and so has requested a loan to buy more quantities of perfumes, incense, cloth and other materials. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her enterprise which, in turn, will enable her to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of perfumes, incense, cloth and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Haba Alkhfgy Group

texts.en:
Zahra is 39 years old and lives with her family. She has started a business of selling perfumes and clothes. She is an uneducated woman from a poor family. She decided to help her family and earn some money to provide better living conditions for her children. She applied for a loan from AMB to buy perfumes and clothes to keep her business running and expand it. She looks forward to making large profits and starting to accumulate money to have her own clothing store.

Zahra is part of Haba Alkhfgy group, which consists of four ladies from Sana'a, Yemen. Each member has her own type of business. They have requested a group loan of 135,000 YER, and they will hold each other accountable for loan repayment.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and clothes to keep her business running and expand it.

loans.name: Roseminda

texts.en:
Roseminda is a young widow who resides in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, with her only son. 

To make a living, she raises pigs for sale, aside from her part-time income. She has borrowed PHP 15,000 to buy piglets to raise. 

She plans to use her profit for the future education of her child. Her dream is to improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe es una señora muy emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante y muchos deseos de superarse en la vida que con 34 años de edad es madre de un solo hijo el cual estudia en un colegio de la comunidad cursando el segundo año de secundaria y que al salir de sus actividades estudiantiles ayuda a sus padres en las diferentes actividades que en el campo se realizan. Ella es casada y junto a su esposo trabajan duro diariamente para poder sacar su familia adelante y seguir fortaleciendo más el patrimonio para su hijo. Guadalupe aprendió el rubro y oficio de la agricultura gracias a sus padres ya que desde muy pequeña los apoyaba en la tierra que el cultivaba. Sus cultivos están ubicados en su misma comunidad a la cual se trasladan en caminando aproximadamente a una distancia de 5 kilómetros. Guadalupe tiene un grado de educación primaria completo el curso gracias al apoyo de sus padres pero no pudo seguir estudiando ya que la economía en su hogar no era la mejor en su juventud pero aprendió a trabajar fuertemente para educar su único hijo.

Ella sueña con ver a su hijo en un mejor futuro, con mejores oportunidades, mejores condiciones de vida para que pueda apoyar a su familia en todo lo necesario. Por lo que ella hoy en día solicita un financiamiento con el cual mejorara sus cultivos dando una mejor asistencia aplicando insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera, fungicidas que evitaran la contaminación de bichos y enfermedades.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a very enterprising woman.  She has a great desire to get ahead and excel in life.  At age 34, she has one child.  He goes to the community school, and he is in his second year of secondary school.  When he leaves his student activities, he helps his parents with the different activities in the field that they do.

She is married.  She and her husband work hard together every day in order to be able to get their family ahead.  They also do this in order to continue strengthening their son’s inheritance.  Guadalupe learned the agricultural trade thanks to her parents.  Ever since she was very little she helped them on the land that they cultivated.

Her crops are located in her own community, and she walks approximately five kilometers to get there.

Guadalupe completed elementary school thanks to the support from her parents.  However, she was not able to continue studying because the finances in her household were not the best during her youth.  However, she learned to work hard in order to educate her only son.

She dreams of seeing her son with a better future, better opportunities, and better living conditions so that he is able to support his family with everything that is needed.

Therefore, she is now requesting a loan to improve her crops by providing better care and applying agricultural supplies like compost, fertilizers, coffee formulas, and fungicides to avoid the contamination of pests and diseases.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies in order to provide care to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Komilkhon

texts.ru: У Комилхон в родном городе Кулоб имеется продуктовый магазин. Он сам работает продавцом и сам поставляет продукты. Маркетингу он научился у отца, который до сих пор помогает Комилхону. В одном доме Комилхон живет со своей семьей, состоявшей из его родителей, жены, дочери и сына. Дети Комилхона еще маленькие, сыну 4 года, дочке 2 годика. Комилхону 27 лет. У него большая семья и весь доход от магазина уходит на семейные расходы. Дети становятся большими и в будущем ему будет необходимо устроить их в образовательные учреждения. Поэтому он уже сейчас думает о расширении своего бизнеса. Комилхон нуждается кредите, чтобы увеличить ассортимент продуктов в магазине и тем самым увеличить доход.
texts.en: Komilkhon has his own food store in his hometown of Kulob.  He works as a salesman and supplies his own products.  He learned marketing from his father, who has been helping Komilkhon.  Komilkhon lives in the same house with his parents, wife, daughter, and son.  Komilkhon's children are still small - his son is 4 and his daughter is 2.  Komilkhon is 27 years old.  He has a large family and all of his earnings from the store go towards the needs of his family.  His children are getting older and it will soon become necessary to arrange for their education.  For this reason he is already thinking about growing his business.  Komilkhon needs a loan in order to improve the assortment of products available at his store and in this way increase his income.

loans.use: to buy food products in order to develop his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fishing net and a fish pen

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en: Manuel runs a motorcycle transport business in his locality.  He has been doing this business for more than ten years to earn a living. His previous loan taken from GDMPC that was used in purchasing spare parts and accessories was successfully repaid. Currently, he has borrowed a new loan of 20,000 PHP to cover the costs of licence renewals. His future plan for his returns was set aside to purchase another unit for business expansion.

loans.use: to cover the costs of licence renewals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a business of tilapia farming.

loans.name: Al-Bshar Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Bshar and consists of four members who are all women. All of them are friends from Sana`a, Yemen. 

Khadiga is 27 years old who is the leader of  group. Her main business is sewing ladies' fabrics. She has been in business for three years. With a few years of experience, she now has a good command of her activity. 

She is taking a loan from AMB and intends to use her loan to better develop her business by purchasing ladies' fabrics for sewing to sell and to increased her profits. Her profits will allow her to help meet her family’s needs. In the future, she would like to have a big sewing factory.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' fabrics for sewing

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es:
Rosa de 65 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, tiene una hija, ya que el hijo falleció hace 9 meses; solamente vive con  una nieta, la hija está trabajando y la sobrina estudia noveno grado.

Ella trabaja como cocinera en un hospital desde hace 25  años,  el trabajo le queda a 10 minutos de su casa, en horario de  las 8 a las 4 de la tarde.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Camp, es para saldar deudas económicas, que tiene con otras personas.  El préstamo le mejorara en quedar solvente, con las otras personas y estar más tranquila.

Los sueños de Rosa, es poder sacar adelante la nieta ya que esta niña le quedo desde que su hijo falleció, le desea proporcionar  la educación.
texts.en:
Rosa, 65 years of age, studied through the sixth grade. She has a daughter and a son who passed away nine months ago but only lives with a granddaughter. Her daughter is working and her niece is studying in ninth grade.

She has worked as a cook in a hospital for 25 years. Her job is 10 minutes away from her house and her hours are 8 am to 4 pm.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Camp is to settle financial debts she has with other people. The loan will improve her ability to remain solvent with these other people and be more peaceful. 

Rosa's dreams are to move forward with her granddaughter since this child has been with her since her son passed away. She wants to provide for her education.

loans.use: to settle financial debts she has with other persons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar panel for her house.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 38 years old, married, and has 3 children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur in the Philippines. 

Marissa helps her husband in managing their own motorcycle transport business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for 6 years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. 

Marissa has been with GDMPC since 2011 and her previous loan that she used to purchase tires was successfully repaid. Recently, Marissa borrowed a new loan of 7,000 PHP to buy motorcycle accessories for a better services. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to be able to buy another unit.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle accessories

loans.name: Khishigsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Khishigsuren, 40 years old, lives with her husband and twin daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been rendering taxi services to local people since 2010. Her husband produces explosives used for the mining industry, and sells them to mining companies. Their twin daughters both go to high school. 

This summer, they began building a new house on their land, but due to the lack of financing, they didn't manage to finish it. So she is requesting a loan of 2,400,000 MNT to buy shingles, vacuum-sealed insulated windows, fiberglass, and hardwood floors to finish the building work. 

As winter is coming closer, she wants her family to live in a comfortable and warm place. The new high-quality house will ensure the family lives in such a place. Also, they will burn less coal for heating, and then release less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to buy shingles, vacuum-sealed insulated windows, fiberglass, and hardwood floor

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Don julio de 69 años de edad se dedica a la venta de granos básicos en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela que lo buscan por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos quienes trabajan y le ayudan el los gastos del hogar, don julio está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas granos básicos por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo, y así podrá tener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Julio is 69 years old and sells bulk grains in the market near his home. He has many customers because they like the quality and the good prices of his products. He lives in his own home with his two children who work and help with household expenses.

Julio is asking for a loan to buy more bulk grains at wholesale prices as this is his only source of income.  This will allow him to earn more money and improve the quality of his life and that of his two children.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma 30, lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur along with her family. She has been running a general store for four years to earn a living as an aid to her husband's income.  

The previous loan she took from GDMPC that she used in her store was successfully repaid. 

Recently, she borrowed 10,000 PHP to purchase more grocery goods, in addition to her working inventory capital. She is hopeful to gain more profit to increase their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods in addition to her working inventory capital

loans.name: Jorenda

texts.en:
Jorenda is running a general store in their village, where she lives with her family. She has been doing this for more than six years, using her previous loans as working capital. She managed her business well, and was able to repay her loans successfully. 

She recently borrowed a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase a variety of grocery products to sell. 

She hopes to improve her business, for it is the only way she could earn an income. 

In the future, she wants to be successful in her business, and to be able to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of grocery products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Enkhtaivan

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhtaivan, 56 years old, lives with his wife and son in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been working as a sentry (guard) at a high school since 2008. At the same high school, his wife works, and her main duty is to hang up jackets after receiving them from students. 

The house his family lives in has been deteriorated over the years, and it needs some repair. So he is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam. Using those materials, he will be able to renovate his house. 

The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution by releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 31 years old and married with an only child, and resides at Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur along with her family.

Maricel owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables in her garden plot to sell to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and her previous loan taken from GDMPC that she used to purchase fertilizer was successfully repaid. 

Recently, she borrowed a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase organic fertilizers and pesticides for her garden. She hopes to properly manage her business to earn more profit and be able to repair their house for better living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers and pesticides for her garden

loans.name: Khadanchuluun

texts.en:
Mr. Khadanchuluun, 26 years old, lives with his mother and sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. He has been working as an electrician at a power station since 2011. His mother sells clothes by renting a stall at a market. 

He is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to buy an automobile which runs on natural gas. 

The advantage of a natural gas vehicle is it emits cleaner pollutants, and wastes less fuel per distance traveled. The car will be used for transportation.

loans.use: to buy a natural gas car

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna runs a general store at Sto. Niño Tukuran in Zamboanga del Sur, where her family lives. She has been in her business for six years, and she earns enough for a living. Her previous loans from GDMPC, which she used in her business, were successfully repaid. 

Recently, she has borrowed a new loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more varieties of grocery products to resell. 

With this investment, she is assured of gaining more profit for her family. In the future, she wants to improve her family's general living situation.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of grocery products to resell

loans.name: Aramis

texts.es: Aramis, tiene 30 años de edad y habita en casa familiar junto a su madre. Desde muy pequeño ha sido un hombre trabajador,  comprometido y responsable. Junto a su madre mantienen la economía de su hogar. Aramis se dedica a la elaboración de fuegos artificiales artesanales y luego los vende en su comunidad. Además le ayuda a su madre en un pequeño negocio de tortillas (Preparación alimenticia de masa de maíz) que poseen desde hace muchos años. Con visión emprendedora  don Aramis y su madre han decidido invertir en el negocio de tortillas ya que no logran cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y ven una oportunidad de crecimiento por esta vía. Aramis se acercó a FUSAI para solicitar este préstamo y poder comprar los insumos necesarios (maíz y gas propano) para  su negocio, tiene muchas expectativas de mejorar su economía con esta inversión.
texts.en:
Aramis, 30, lives with his mother in the family home.  He’s been a hardworking, committed, responsible person since childhood.  He and his mother support the home.  Aramis works making artisanal fireworks to sell in his community.  He also helps his mother with a small tortilla making business (food prepared from corn dough) that they’ve had for many years.

With his and his mother’s enterprising vision they’ve decided to invest in the tortilla business because they are no longer able to meet customer demand and they see a path to grow this way.  Aramis approached FUSAI to request this loan to buy necessary supplies (corn and propane) for his business.  He has high hopes of improving his economy with this investment.

loans.use: to buy corn and propane.

loans.name: Ariuntuya

texts.en: Mrs. Ariuntuya, 46 years old, lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a driving school since 2007 while her husband takes care of running a pub. Their elder daughter studies in Taiwan for a bachelor degree in international relations. She is requesting a loan of 4700000 MNT to pay for her daughter's tuition fee. She thinks the best thing she can do for her daughter is to invest in her education and open her opportunities for better life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fee
